title: newAthletic Therapist
description:
Tx Thérapies est une clinique multi-disciplinaire située dans le Vieux-Montréal, offrant des services en physiothérapie, massothérapie, kinésithérapie et thérapie du sport. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un ou d'une Thérapeute du sport pour se joindre à notre équipe composée de professionnels de la santé agréés.

Le candidat doit :

  • Être titulaire d'un baccalauréat en thérapie du sport
  • Atout : avoir complété une formation en massothérapie et être membre d’une association de massothérapie reconnue
  • Avoir de bonnes capacités en évaluation
  • Avoir des connaissances approfondies en pathologies
  • Être en mesure d'exécuter des traitements efficaces ainsi que de prescrire des plans d'exercices et de traitement adéquats
  • Posséder des connaissances et de l’expérience en entraînement physique
  • Souhaiter établir une pratique à long terme au sein de la clinique

--

Tx Therapies is a multi-disciplinary clinic located in Old Montréal, we offer physiotherapy, massage therapy, kinesiology and Athletic therapy. We are currently looking for an Athletic Therapist, to join our team of health professionals.

The ideal candidate must:

  • Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Athletic Therapy
  • Asset : Have completed supplemental training in massage therapy and be licensed to provide massage therapy receipts with a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Possess good evaluation skills
  • Have advanced knowledge of pathologies
  • Be able to execute effective treatments, as well as prescribe adequate exercise plans
  • Possess knowledge of and experience in physical training
  • Wish to establish long-term practice within the clinic

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $35.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Athletic therapy: 1 year (preferred)

title: Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist
description:
Athletic/Fascial Stretch Therapist
You are a fun, personable, outgoing practitioner and have a desire to excel in private practice. You’re always looking to develop your clinical knowledge and skills, and are eager to take on new and exciting challenges. Perhaps you are looking for your first role in a practice or maybe you just aren’t fulfilled with your career so far and know that there is a better opportunity waiting for you.

You’ll be our future therapist who has a strong interest in pursuing a fascial stretch therapy certification or already has one.

You’ll have great people skills, fantastic communication and enjoy working as part of a dynamic team and having a laugh and banter in our vibrant culture. You want to earn a fantastic salary and be financially rewarded as you grow your caseload. You want the opportunity to become more than just a standard team member because you know that you are able to deliver much much more.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is an award-winning wellness clinic featured on BlogTo and GlobalTV. Established in 1989 the Rosedale Wellness Centre has become one of Canada's leaders in providing quality care and innovative wellness programs for the community. With over 40 practitioners under one roof, Rosedale Wellness Centre provides a magnitude of different services. Some of the services include Chiropractic, Physiotherapy, Athletic Therapy, Naturopathy, Massage Therapy, Acupuncture, and Personal Training.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is currently looking for Certified Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist to join their busy downtown wellness centre.

Job Description

Prevention

  • Instruction to individuals on the use and application of commercially made or custom-made protective equipment to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • When required, provide custom-made devices or properly apply commercially made products in order to provide prophylactic/protective measures to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • Patient education on risks and corrective actions associated with participation in fitness and sport programs, workplace ergonomics and musculoskeletal injury prevention in both the active lifestyle and workplace settings
  • Facilitate physical conditioning by designing and implementing programs to reduce the risk of injury, illness or health-related conditions

Assessment

  • Formulate an Athletic Therapy diagnosis by interpreting the mechanism of injury; determining signs, symptoms and predisposing factors of an injury, illness or health related condition; performing specific physical, orthopedic or fitness testing in accordance with accepted procedures to assess an injury, illness and/or health related condition
  • Assess for/recognize the potential of a sport related traumatic brain injury/concussion
  • Assess the biomechanical impact of injury, illness or health-related condition to promote ergonomically correct function
  • Reassess the status of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions using standard techniques and documentation to determine appropriate treatment, rehabilitation and/or fitness and reconditioning plans

Intervention

  • When an emergency plan is activated, employ life-saving techniques through the use of standard emergency procedures to reduce the incidence of morbidity and mortality
  • Prevent exacerbation of non-life-threatening conditions through the use of standard procedures to reduce morbidity
  • Engage in rehabilitative therapy (including electrical, thermal, and mechanical modalities) using standard techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function, and/or performance
  • Administer therapeutic and conditioning exercise(s) using both standard and advanced techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance either pre- or post-injury or surgical intervention, as well as for general illnesses or conditions related to the musculoskeletal system
  • Educate and provide guidance and/or counseling to patients and individuals in the treatment, rehabilitation and reconditioning of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance
  • Educate, provide guidance and/or counseling for, and administer appropriate return protocols for patients returning from sport related traumatic brain injuries

Practice Management

  • Use an information management system to maintain appropriate medical records/documentation to comply with accepted best practice guidelines

Professional Responsibility

  • Adhere to policies and procedures for the delivery of healthcare services following accepted guidelines to promote safe participation, timely care and legal compliance
  • Maintain records using a system to document professional services rendered to provide quality healthcare services
  • Adhere to statutory and regulatory provisions for the practice of Athletic Therapy by maintaining an understanding of these provisions and responsibilities to contribute to the safety and welfare of the public

Interested candidates, please email your resume. New grads accepted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $22.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site gym
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • fascial stretch: 1 year (preferred)
  • athletic therapy: 1 year (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Our office is Hiring Multiple Therapists Positions!!

Enhanced Health & Wellness is looking to add a Registered Massage therapist, Registered Physiotherapist, Registered Naturopath, Registered Acupuncturist, Registered Osteopath and more.

Our office has recently expanded into a brand new location with the intent to grow as a multi-disciplinary clinic, we would like to provide a team of experienced and qualified members to help patients focus on recovery and worry less on going to multiple offices for treatment.

This is a contractor position

We offer:

  • Full reception and billing services
  • Jane online booking system
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Support for future growth and advancing your career
  • Competitive percentage-based income
  • Rehabilitation area to work with patients
  • An enjoyable work environment
  • Laundry Facilities
  • staff lunch room
  • High Traffic location

Candidate Highlights:

  • Must employ a collaborative approach to care. This means they should be open to referring to other practitioners in the clinic whether it be Chiropractic, Massage, Physiotherapy or Acupuncture (or any other services we may offer in the future) as they will be getting referrals from these in house practitioners as well.
  • Willing to actively work on building up their patient base
  • Responsible, punctual, and reliable
  • Must be registered with an association of Alberta
  • Personable and able to build rapport with patients

New Grads and Experienced practitioners are welcome

If you are looking to join a team and expand your career, we are the place for you. Please email your resume today.

Work remotely

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
About us

RECOVR Physiotherapy is an upcoming new physiotherapy clinic. We are customer-centric, rewarding and professional.

Our work environment includes:

  • Growth opportunities
  • Safe work environment
  • Lively atmosphere

Our physiotherapy clinic is looking for a Massage Therapist who is able to work with patients to develop a schedule that fits their needs. The ideal candidate will be able to maintain a calming, therapeutic environment and must be able to provide effective techniques and treatments that promote general wellness. We are seeking a Massage Therapist who will help us create an exclusive and friendly environment for our clients.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide a soothing, therapeutic massage to patients.
  • Greet clients in a professional and friendly manner.
  • Listen carefully to patients' needs and respond accordingly by recommending appropriate services or techniques.
  • Fully explain the process of the massage to patients before performing service.
  • Provide the highest level of customer satisfaction possible.
  • Work with or contact other health care providers as needed to ensure the patient receives the best quality care.
  • Utilize a wide range of manipulation techniques to reduce pain.
  • Keep excellent records of patient health and treatment options.
  • Promote relaxation for clients to ensure the maximum benefit of the massage.

Experience:

1-2years experience preferred

Massage therapist licence and certifications required

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $34.00-$38.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Expected start date: 2022-05-09

title: Massage Therapist
description:
2200 Hour Massage Therapist – Stony Plain, Alberta.

Body Renewal Massage Therapy Clinic is looking to welcome an exceptional Massage Therapist with 2200-hour certification to complement our close-knit team. We offer a great opportunity to work in a relaxed, friendly environment and to expand your knowledge and experience. Body Renewal has a reputation for providing the highest quality of health treatments and client service. We are a well-established clinic of 20 plus years, serving clients from Stony Plain, Spruce Grove, Parkland County, Edmonton and surrounding area.

This is a great opportunity to work in a Therapeutic clinic focused on client rehabilitation. Applicants must be a member of a recognized Alberta association and carry liability insurance. Multiple modalities are an asset, but not required. CPR/First Aid must be up to date.

We are currently seeking a full-time therapist however part-time may be considered. We are primarily a rent-based therapist-run clinic, however commission may be considered for the first three months if that is the preference of the successful candidate. Along with providing an educated and effective massage therapy experience, responsibilities include maintaining accurate notes of treatments performed, adhering to your regulatory body’s set of ethics and standards at all times, and laundry/cleaning/office duties as required. Training for clinic scheduling system and direct billing will be provided.

Please send your resume and cover letter to: Jackie Friedel, Co-Owner, Body Renewal Massage Therapy Clinic .

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $50.00 to $70.00 /hour

  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We realize that in Alberta most of the restrictions for Covid-19 are more relaxed, however our clinic space will still have sanitizing practices in place and some screening questions for both clients and staff. We want everyone to comfortable.

  • massage therapy: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist (preferred)

title: Part Time Therapy/Administrative Assistant
description:
Linford Chiropractic Sports Therapy and Massage Clinic is seeking a dynamic, and outgoing individual to fill the need for a Permanent Part Time Therapy/Administrative Assistant role within our clinic. We recently filled our full time role and are now seeking to fill a more part time role. We invite applicants who recently applied for our full time job posting that are interested in this part time role to apply again.

Responsibilities Include:

- Assisting with Doctor prescribed therapies, and working in a fast-paced team environment

- Setting patients up on various treatment modalities

- Preparing and cleaning treatment areas between patients

- Basic laundry, cleaning, and equipment inventory tasks

- Performing routine office functions such as reception, patient scheduling, as well as handling patient and insurance billing

Candidate must be personable, energetic, and have a strong work ethic. They must be able to multitask in a fast-paced environment, be comfortable performing therapies on patients, and have strong computer skills. Previous schooling or experience is an asset but not a requirement as all training is done in clinic.

Candidate must be available to work scheduled shifts during our daytime clinic hours (shifts may vary slightly):

Mondays 9:30am - 12:45pm & 2:30pm – 6:30pm

Tuesdays 2pm - 6:30pm

Wednesdays 9:30am – 12:45pm & 2:30pm – 5:45pm

Thursdays 2pm - 6:30pm

Fridays 8am – 1:00pm

Saturdays (1-2 per month) 9am -12: 45pm

Scheduled hours of work are approximately 22 - 30 hours per week and our starting compensation ranges from $16-$19 per hour depending on experience. To apply for this position please email your resume. Visit our website at www.linfordchiropractic.ca for more information about our clinic. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $16.00-$19.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

title: newAssistant Athletic Therapist
description:
Overview:
Term: 7 Months

This position is accountable to the Manager, Therapy & Performance Services to provide therapeutic treatments involved in the prevention, immediate care, rehabilitation and reconditioning of sports injuries sustained by student-athletes at the University. The incumbent also provides in-service training, scheduling and management of all student therapists assigned to their sports. The incumbent makes available all therapy services necessary for student-athletes and others participating in the varsity program environment while also treating general patients who utilize the Athletic Therapy clinics at the University.
Responsibilities:
Injury prevention/care
  • Provides all applicable care including injury prevention, education, acute and non-acute injury management, and rehabilitation for any injuries related to any varsity sports, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to attend practices for varsity sport programs, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • May be required to attend home and/or away games, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to treat a number of paid clients. Goals set in consultation with the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Use of secondary health care certification skill set when applicable
Collaboration/Communication
  • Provides regular updates to coaches related to pertinent injury information about their respective student-athletes
  • Collaborates as needed with Strength and Conditioning staff in regards to injury status of studentathletes
  • Communicates with various members of the Health Care team, including Sports Medicine Physicians, surgeons, chiropractors, etc,
  • May need to communicate with other members of the department as it relates to facilities, scheduling, booking, and invoicing
Mentorship/Education
  • Collaborates with AHS/Kin to recruit and train student trainers
  • Provides monthly learning sessions to further educate current student trainers
  • Assists with the yearly Student Trainer Orientation, to train and improve skills of new and returning student trainers
  • Oversees student trainers volunteering in the clinic
Clinical Administration
  • Completes any pertinent paperwork required to record major injuries requiring activation of EMS for care of injured student-athletes
  • Completes daily injury notes for all student-athletes seen in the clinic
  • Provides statistical reports reflecting injury rates, epidemiology, clinical revenue etc, to the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
Clinic Promotion/Support
  • Collaborates with department marketing team to develop and implement strategies to increase clinic revenue
  • Utilizes social media as a promotional tool for the clinic
  • Maintains and expands relationships with community partners
  • Communicates with on-campus organizations to increase clinical access for students
  • Actively involved with the promotion of the clinics to clients from the community
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a health-related field
  • Diploma/Degree/Masters in the field of Athletic Therapy from an accredited institution required
  • Maintained status in the Canadian Athletic Therapists Association
  • Minimum First Responder certified
  • Secondary certification in health care an asset (ie chiropractic, occupational therapy, registered massage therapist)
  • Maintained status in applicable secondary governing body
  • Experience in a USports institution as an Athletic/Student Therapist preferred
  • Experience with contact sports (hockey, rugby, football) is an asset
  • Experience mentoring/teaching is an asset
  • Current in the area of clinical modalities, equipment, therapeutic techniques, and supplies related to therapy
  • Ability to communicate with all members of the Sports Medicine team, various coaches and athletes, and other members of the Department in a professional manner
  • Time management skills are essential
  • Maintain a clear Police Vulnerable Sector Check
  • Required to work evenings and weekends as needed
Vaccination Requirement Statement:
Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the University’s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The University’s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.
Equity Statement:
The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion. As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

description:
We are presently looking to add an Athletic Therapist to our team. After 16 years we recently moved to a larger location and we are expanding our services. Between chiro, physio, massage and other services, we get anywhere from 80 to 150 patients through our clinic each day..

Salary is fully negotiable as is the work schedule. Our new clinic has 3 brand new, unused rooms available and a fully functioning MEDEX gym along with some free weights.

There is no set start date required.

Clinic hours:

  • Monday: 8:30am to 8:00pm
  • Tuesday: 8:30am to 5:00pm
  • Wednesday: 8:30am to 8:00pm
  • Thursday: 8:30am to 7:00pm
  • Friday: 8:30am to 5:00pm
  • Saturday: 8:30am to 1:00pm

Please send your resume if you are interested in applying for the position.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent, Freelance

Salary: $25.00-$50.00 per hour

  • Weekend availability

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Massage Therapist

Luxury and tranquility in an authentic setting, await our Guests at The Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge. As a Massage Therapist our guests will enjoy the professional and personalized spa experience you offer. The expertise and attention to detail you provide during their treatment will ensure our guests have a memory to share.

Covid-19 Safety Policy: In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

What is in it for you:

  • $1000 Bonus to assist with Relocation, paid upon first pay period after Orientation. Minimum 12 month commitment required, otherwise repayment will be necessary upon resignation.
  • Competitive wage includes hourly rate + commission + service charge (Starting at $65.63 per treatment based on a basic 60 minute service, up to $93.93 per high end 90 minute service)
  • 8% Retail commission and product incentives
  • Paid Vacation / Flexible Schedule Options
  • Complimentary health club access (includes fitness centre, steam, sauna) and boat house rentals
  • Subsidized staff accommodation provided on-site for full time status
  • Competitive extended benefits package including medical, vision and dental for full time permanent status
  • Employee Travel Program
  • Comprehensive Wellness Platform (LifeWorks)
  • Discounts on food & beverage/spa/golf
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge and over 5,000 properties with Accor

What you will be doing:

Reporting to the Spa Director, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

  • Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service
  • Follow departmental policies and procedures
  • Perform all 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minute massage and body treatments as trained
  • Ensure individualized guest service through acknowledging and responding to needs and expectation while maintaining the clients comfort at all times
  • Maintain clean, hygienic and neat work environment at all times, ensuring all equipment in safe working order
  • Adhere to Body Tech safety procedures and practices and departmental Emergency Procedures/Safety Manual
  • Actively participate in learning spa's operations, i.e. body treatments, product knowledge, retail sales, Energy Masters Program
  • Assist guests regarding hotel facilities in an informative and helpful way
  • Support other teams within department as required, i.e. Spa Attendants, Spa Reception
  • Other duties as assigned

Your experience and skills include:


  • Previous experience as a Massage Therapist required
  • Certification from an accredited school of Massage required, 2200 hour course is required (Certified Registered Massage Therapist)
  • Registered within province of Alberta prior to beginning employment
  • Current professional licenses
  • CPR and First Aid certification is required
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities
  • Highly responsible & reliable
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work cohesively with fellow colleagues as part of a team with minimum supervision
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Your team and working environment:

  • Fast-paced, upscale, luxury hotel
  • Close proximity to Marmot Basin Ski Resort in winter and world-renowned hiking trails in summer
  • Hospitality employees worldwide making this a great place to develop lifelong connections
  • Sitting – 1-8 hrs/day
  • Walking: 1-3 hrs/day
  • Standing: 3-4 hrs/day
  • Bending/Reaching: 1-3 hrs/day
  • Pushing/Pulling: 1-2 hrs/day
  • Physical effort: medium – required to lift up to 40 lbs

Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for AccorHotels?

We are much more than a world leader. We are more than 250,000 hoteliers with a purposeful and heartfelt mission: to make every guest Feel Welcome in our 4,500 addresses and on our digital platforms. We are committed to a culture and guided by our values that make our talent Feel Valued. We want them to express their passions every day and realize their full potential through exemplary professional development and growth opportunities, enjoying a life filled with unlimited experiences. To connect with us, please visit https://www.accorhotels.jobs/home.aspx

title: Fascial Stretch Therapist
company: Fit for Life Wellness & Rehabilitation Centre
description:
Fit for Life Wellness & Rehabilitation Centre is a multidisciplinary wellness centre committed to offering excellent patient care. We have many clients that need physiotherapy services. We are located within the Vellore community in Vaughan, Ontario, and have provided quality rehabilitation to the surrounding communities for over 10 years. We have a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of providers including Chiropractors, Physiotherapist, Naturopathic Doctor, Registered Massage Therapists, Acupuncturist and Nutritionist. Our team is a cohesive and friendly group of providers and administrative staff and we are looking for a passionate and dedicated person to join our team.

We Offer:

· Consistent work schedule with growing clientele

· Flexibility to develop a work schedule

· Spacious, established and clean work environment, bright with many windows

· Private & curtain treatment rooms with gym area

· Assistant available for exercise programming

· Growing clinic and expanding which will enable further opportunity

· Professional development encouraged and supported

What we are looking for in a Candidate:

· Excellent organizational and communication skills

- Fascial Stretch Theraipist (qualified with certification). Holding a registration in another health profession is an asset.

· Ability to adapt quickly to shifting priorities

· Positive team player and willing to work inter-professionally with other health providers

· Professional liability insurance.

· Experience working with MVA and WSIB is an asset but not required.

· Commitment to customer service and inter-professional teamwork.

· Ability to work independently as well as interdependently with the other health care team members.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Provide assessment, diagnosis, treatment and health education.
  • Work with a multidisciplinary team to achieve optimum patient outcomes.

Maintain complete and accurate electronic medical records.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 6-8 per week

Pay: $60.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Company description

We are a group of like-minded practitioners committed to raising consciousness and working with community. We operate from a mindset of integrity & joy. Our goal is to create an environment that is safe and serene. Soluna integrates elements that promote healing by stimulating the human senses. Integrated into our treatments -calming colours, essentials oils, incense, crystals, hot stones, & specific sound frequencies. Our best asset is our therapists, practitioners, and employees therefore our culture and focus is them. We strive to keep our therapists growing, learning, and happy. We offer Massage, Reiki, Holistic modalities, Osteopathy, Acupuncture, Soul Coaching, Yoga, & Meditation classes.

Job description

What we offer:

60/40 commission split increase with consideration of clientele, additional modalities, & experience

Yearly reviews for increase in percentage

CEC support- paid for with parameters and contract

Self Care Program- monthly maintenance services

Funding for commitment to personal development retreats and seminars

Our priority is to offer our therapists a safe, open, and inclusive environment with training and knowledge on inclusivity and prejudice

Access to Yoga & Meditation classes

Generous discount on locally curated products

Supplies

Every room is equipped with: Electric lift tables, ergonomic stools, towel warmers, thermaphore, table warmer, high quality linens, sanitary pillows, bolsters, and towels.

Access to: hot stones & warmers, Theragun, Cupping system, bottle warmer & array of oils/lotions

Assets

Experience & openness working with energy & an array of spiritual & natural modalities

Experience working with CBD

2200hr practical and scholarly training

Students are welcome with

Good standing with accredited association

Able to work with a diverse group of people and community

Reliable transportation (limited public transportation to space)

Our clinic is located on the second floor and requires use of stairs to access

(We have programs in place to keep our services and treatments accessible to clients that we cannot cater to on-site)

  • Tips

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

  • good standing with accredited association (preferred)

  • No

Join Our Team!

❀ Located in Kingston, ON

The Orchid Massage & Wellness Centre is looking for a Registered Massage Therapists to join our team in June of 2022. We are located in Kingston’s West End, our facility features quiet comfortable rooms in a relaxing spa like setting.

We support your professional needs, provide a great work environment, and fully accommodate our clientele.

Our facility was built for RMT’s by RMT’s. With the help of a professional interior designer, we created a space that is not only beautiful, but functionally designed with you in mind.

Large, open lobby & reception area with two reception desks so we can check in & check out clientele more efficiently. Fully integrated client management software for seamless booking, scheduling, payments & file management.

Our large staff lounge offers ample seating and dining areas, with a kitchenette and separate staff washroom. A separate office for charting, a lobby monitor so you can view when your clients arrive, individual coat, shoes/personal items storage & dedicated staff entrance.

✔ Base wage paid whenever you are working (Charting, Cleaning, Client No Shows)

Off-Site Linen Washing & Sanitizing Service. Linens are delivered folded and ready to use.

Predictable income.
✔ We take care of your Remittances and HST.
✔ Professional Year-Round Marketing Campaign.
✔ Full administrative support and reception coverage

Our goal is to provide great opportunities with living wages and a great working environment with a strong & supportive leadership team. As a family run business, we know our team is our greatest asset.

title: newAssistant Athletic Therapist (Football)
description:
Overview:
Term: 3 Years

This position is accountable to the Manager, Therapy & Performance Services to provide therapeutic treatments involved in the prevention, immediate care, rehabilitation and reconditioning of sports injuries sustained by student-athletes at the University. The incumbent also provides in-service training, scheduling and management of all student therapists assigned to their sports. The incumbent makes available all therapy services necessary for student-athletes and others participating in the varsity program environment while also treating general patients who utilize the Athletic Therapy clinics at the University.
Responsibilities:
Injury prevention/care
  • Provides all applicable care including injury prevention, education, acute and non-acute injury management, and rehabilitation for any injuries related to any varsity sports, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to attend practices for varsity sport programs, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • May be required to attend home and/or away games, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to treat a number of paid clients. Goals set in consultation with the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Use of secondary health care certification skill set when applicable
Collaboration/Communication
  • Provides regular updates to coaches related to pertinent injury information about their respective student-athletes
  • Collaborates as needed with Strength and Conditioning staff in regards to injury status of student-athletes
  • Communicates with various members of the Health Care team, including Sports Medicine Physicians, surgeons, chiropractors, etc,
  • May need to communicate with other members of the department as it relates to facilities, scheduling, booking, and invoicing
Mentorship/Education
  • Collaborates with AHS/Kin to recruit and train student trainers
  • Provides monthly learning sessions to further educate current student trainers
  • Assists with the yearly Student Trainer Orientation, to train and improve skills of new and returning student trainers
  • Oversees student trainers volunteering in the clinic
Clinical Administration
  • Completes any pertinent paperwork required to record major injuries requiring activation of EMS for care of injured student-athletes
  • Completes daily injury notes for all student-athletes seen in the clinic
  • Provides statistical reports reflecting injury rates, epidemiology, clinical revenue etc, to the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
Clinic Promotion/Support
  • Collaborates with department marketing team to develop and implement strategies to increase clinic revenue
  • Utilizes social media as a promotional tool for the clinic
  • Maintains and expands relationships with community partners
  • Communicates with on-campus organizations to increase clinical access for students
  • Actively involved with the promotion of the clinics to clients from the community
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a health-related field
  • Diploma/Degree/Masters in the field of Athletic Therapy from an accredited institution required
  • Maintained status in the Canadian Athletic Therapists Association
  • Minimum First Responder certified
  • Secondary certification in health care an asset (ie chiropractic, occupational therapy, registered massage therapist)
  • Maintained status in applicable secondary governing body
  • Experience in a USports institution as an Athletic/Student Therapist preferred
  • Experience with contact sports (hockey, rugby, football) is an asset
  • Experience mentoring/teaching is an asset
  • Current in the area of clinical modalities, equipment, therapeutic techniques, and supplies related to therapy
  • Ability to communicate with all members of the Sports Medicine team, various coaches and athletes, and other members of the Department in a professional manner
  • Time management skills are essential
  • Maintain a clear Police Vulnerable Sector Check
  • Required to work evenings and weekends as needed
Vaccination Requirement Statement:
Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the University’s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The University’s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.
Equity Statement:
The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion. As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
We are looking for a Massage Therapist who is hard-working and dedicated to a team type environment.

-Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service
-Perform massage while maintaining the client's comfort at all times
-Perform 60, 90 minutes massages and facial as required
-Ensure individualized guest service through acknowledging and responding to their needs and expectation
-Maintain a clean, hygienic and neat work environment at all times, ensuring all equipment is in safe working order
-Follow departmental policies and procedures
-Follow all safety and sanitation policies

-Previous experience as a Massage Therapist required
-Excellent communication and organizational skills
-Strong interpersonal and problem-solving abilities
-Highly responsible, reliable and punctual is key.
-Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $35.00-$60.00 per hour

Salary: $40.00-$60.00 per hour

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

  • Massage Therapists: 2 years (preferred)
  • massage therapy: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (preferred)

title: newMassage Therapist
description:
Be Part of an Advanced Healthcare Team!

We’re seeking a passionate RMT to meet the demands of our growing clientele, full caseload waiting for you! We are seeking an RMT who’s diversified in techniques and is able to work a variety of shifts.

You are a good fit if:

  • You love what you do
  • You provide treatment that you would want to receive yourself
  • You want to feel good about what you do at the end of the day
  • You get what it means to make strong connections with your patients
  • You are registered with the CMTO
  • You like to have fun at work!

What are the perks?

  • Learn a lot. Surround yourself with passionate colleagues who are top notch in their game and thrive working alongside like-minded individuals.
  • Think outside of the box. We are not your ordinary clinic. We are always trying to improve, be better!
  • Work with awesome clients. They tell us they love our energy and look forward to coming for their visits. Check out our google reviews!
  • No WSIB or MVA patients. That means way less paperwork.
  • Job Security, employee position with health benefits and more
  • Spend time doing what you enjoy, we provide pretty much everything you need (we even do all your laundry!)

Join our busy team of professionals and work alongside fellow RMT’s, Physiotherapists, Athletic Therapist and Movement Therapists. COMPHYSIO+ is a top rated clinic on Google and winners of the Top Choice Award 2020-2022!

We are centrally located in Barrie within a modern 5,000 sq.ft. facility, our clinic features private treatment rooms and a large private gym.

Please submit a coverletter and CV. We look forward to connecting with you soon.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 15-30 per week

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (preferred)

title: RMT (registered massage therapist)
description:
Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

  • Certification by a provincial or territorial association for massage therapists

Specific Skills

  • Assess clients by conducting range of motion and muscle tests and propose treatment plans
  • Explain procedures, risks and benefits to clients
  • Administer massage techniques through soft tissue manipulation, relaxation techniques, hydrotherapy, trigger point therapy, joint pain and lower grade mobilizations
  • Suggest home care instructions and provide information about techniques
  • Massage and knead muscles and soft tissues of the body
  • Apply finger and hand pressure to specific points of the body

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Repetitive tasks
  • Standing for extended periods

Health benefits

  • Dental plan
  • Vision care benefits
skills: ['Explain procedures, risks and benefits to clients', 'Dental plan', 'Apply finger and hand pressure to specific points of the body', 'Standing for extended periods', 'Repetitive tasks', 'Suggest home care instructions and provide information about techniques']

title: Registered Massage Therapist (New Grads Welcome!)
description:
Motion Care Massage & Rehab is a clinic located in the heart of North York at Yonge/Sheppard. We are looking to hire Registered Massage Therapists who have the interest to work in a multidisciplinary (DC, RMT, PT, Pelvic health, ND, Acupuncturist) clinic. The successful candidate will be joining an enthusiastic and dedicated team of health care professionals committed to providing top quality, integrated care.

Founded by an owner with dual licensing of Doctor of Chiropractic and Registered Massage Therapy who knows the industry and will help you achieve your goals!

Position includes:

  • Flexible days and hours, our clinic will be open 7 days/week
  • All equipment and supplies included
  • Front desk support
  • Paperless office with electronic clinical notes and charting
  • Monthly Rounds (where the team gets together, eat and learn!)

Location PERKS

  • 30 seconds walk from yonge/sheppard northwest subway exit
  • Off Major highway 401
  • FREE parking for employees
  • Lots of food spots around the corner =)

If you are interested in joining a fun-filled environment clinic, please send us your resume!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $62.25-$71.19 per hour

Application question(s):

  • Are you available on Thursday to work?
  • Are you available on Sunday to work?

Licence/Certification:

  • CMTO license (required)

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist
description:
We are a growing multidisciplinary clinic, with a growing clientele in need of massage therapists immediately. Our location features private room settings, as well as gym equipment for active rehabilitation. Our philosophy prioritizes a hands-on approach along with traditional modalities, to help treat a wide range of acute and chronic injuries, as well as aid our clients in achieving their health-related goals. Our clientele is varied, ranging from the athletic to general population to those with disabilities or special needs.

We are looking to hire Massage Therapists (Registered) to join our growing team. Our therapists work together for inter-office referrals, in addition to receiving new patients from outside sources.

Our massage therapists are expected to provide our patients with a wide variety of treatment styles as well as treatment plans to improve our patients' health.

We are located at Church and Bloor. Within a 5 minute walk from the subway station.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $75.00-$90.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Necessary precautions are taken to prevent the spread of COVID.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (required)

description:
Elmwood Spa, is Toronto’s leading day spa and the largest day spa in Canada.  We offer careers that are both satisfying and rewarding.

We are always looking to hire Registered Massage Therapists that can work a variety of shifts which include days, evenings, and weekends.  Come join Elmwood Spa/elmspa where we have been pampering and providing well-being for guests for over 35 years. 

10 positions available in permanent, full-time roles. We are located at 18 Elm St. Toronto, ON M5G 1G7. 

We follow strict COVID-19 safety, cleaning, and disinfecting protocols for our Spa, so our employees will feel confident coming into a safe workplace and be able to treat clients effectively while doing what they love. 

Staff are provided with PPE, sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures are in place.  Temperature screenings for staff and guests.  Physical distancing guidelines in place.

Work for a company that recognizes your value and provides you with opportunities for upward growth, apply to join our aspirational team!

Full-time, Part-time (weekends included)

Key Responsibilities:

Provides guests/clients with a complete treatment adhering to the Company's standards of consistency and protocol and within the framework of the regulations established by the CMTO;
-Contributes to and strives to achieve our objective of creating and offering a seamless 'magical' experience for every guest by anticipating needs and health conditions with the client's health and safety being paramount;
-Ensures proper documentation of after service notes and that treatment notes are recorded on the health form indicating (at minimum) techniques used, length of massage, and whether a receipt was issued;
-Ensures massage rooms and common areas are kept neat, clean and clutter free at all times and all equipment is in safe and working order;
-Actively promotes retail sales through educating, recommending and up-selling products to our guests; working towards a 5% retail to service ratio.
-Participates fully and enthusiastically in the implementation of all new initiatives;
-Helps to educate and provide support to all staff members within the company whenever there is an opportunity;
-Participates in finding viable solutions to any issues or concerns that may present a challenge to the department or business;
-Provides coverage for other RMT's as and when required;
-Attends and contributes at regularly scheduled Department Meetings;
-Assists with other duties within the Spa as reasonably assigned from time to time.

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Personal protective equipment provided.
  • Temperature screenings for staff and guests
  • Physical distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

BUILD A CAREER WITH BENEFITS

  • Graduate Assistance Program (GAP)
  • $1500 Signing Bonus (SB)
  • Competitive Hourly Rate + Premiums
  • Learn new modalities to advance your career and get paid while learning.
  • Health benefits (medical, dental & vision)
  • Tuition reimbursement for FT employees

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • valid registration with CMTO or eligible to obtain
  • Proof of valid liability/malpractice insurance
  • Reliable
  • Effective communicator (English written and spoken)
  • Passionate, nurturing, and caring disposition

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Description

Midtown est à la recherche d'un massothérapeute pour s'assurer que les membres et les invités vivent des expériences de spa luxueuses.

Le poste

Faisant partie intégrante de l'équipe du spa, nos massothérapeutes sont des professionnels compétents et attentionnés, intéressés par le bien-être et la satisfaction personnelle de nos membres et invités. Ils connaissent les dernières tendances et techniques de massage et ont un impact positif sur le succès de notre club en démontrant les avantages du massage à nos clients.

Responsabilités du massothérapeute :

  • Répondre aux besoins de manière professionnelle, positive et opportune
  • Organiser le poste de travail, la salle de traitement, l'éclairage, le son et se renseigner auprès du niveau de confort des clients tout au long du service
  • Maintenir la propreté des zones du spa tout au long du quart de travail, éliminer les déchets et les conduites sales et sécuriser les fournitures à la fin du quart de travail
  • Collaborer avec d'autres associés et les aider à promouvoir les services du spa et à atteindre les objectifs du service
  • Effectuer des traitements pour les clients et maintenir la propreté et les normes d'assainissement de la salle de traitement pour le confort et la sécurité des clients
  • Promouvoir les services de spa/salon et vendre des produits au détail

Exigences du massothérapeute :

  • Au moins un an d'expérience et une licence d'état en cours
  • Certifié par une école de massothérapie crédible
  • Expérience antérieure en service à la clientèle préférée

Midtown is looking for a Massage Therapist to ensure that members and guests have luxurious spa experiences.

The Position

As an integral part of the spa team, our Massage Therapists are knowledgeable and caring professionals, interested in the well-being and personal satisfaction of our members and guests. They are skilled in the latest massage trends and techniques, and, have a positive impact on the success of our club by demonstrating the benefits of massage to our clients.

Massage Therapist responsibilities:

  • Address needs in a professional, positive, and timely manner
  • Arrange work station, treatment room, lighting, sound and inquire with guest comfort level throughout service
  • Maintain cleanliness of spa areas throughout shift, dispose of trash and dirty lines, and secure supplies at end of shift
  • Partner with and assisting other associates to promote spa services and achieve department goals
  • Perform treatments for guests and maintain treatment room cleanliness and sanitation standard for guest comfort and safety
  • Promote Spa/salon services and sell retail products

Massage Therapist requirements:

  • At least one year of experience and a current state license
  • Certified by a credible massage therapy school
  • Previous customer service experience preferred

This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

MIDTOWN is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Registered Massage Therapy (RMT) Clinic Supervisor
description:
About Us

 

For more than 50 years, CDI College has been one of the leading career training institutions in Canada, thanks to its commitment to quality education and the success of its students. Our rich history includes alumni of thousands of successful graduates who embark on careers rich in opportunity. We are happy to say that we are looking for an experienced Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor to join our Instructor team! 

The purpose of the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor is to lead and contribute to the academic success of students and to the success of the College in achieving its statement of purpose. Under general direction, the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor is responsible for providing stage supervision and facilitating student learning according to the prescribed curriculum.

Job Responsibilities

Specifically, the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor will be responsible for

  • Monitoring and reviewing students during clinical placements
  • Evaluating student performance fairly and consistently
  • Supporting the administrative functions of the campus to enhance the student experience
  • Acting in a manner that upholds the College standards

Qualifications

 

To be successful in the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor position, individuals must be committed to developing, maintaining and demonstrating the following:

Education and Experience:

  • Degree or diploma from a recognized University or College in a relevant discipline.
  • Three or more years’ experience in a related field, or the equivalent combination of education and teaching experience.
  • Current membership/licence with relevant regulatory body preferred.
  • Satisfy specific position qualifications as prescribed in program design and program approval for the instruction of the courses. 

Skills and Abilities:

  • Relevant industry skills and knowledge relating to the area of instruction.
  • Interest in pedagogical and multi-modal education approaches an asset.
  • Advanced oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to motivate and inspire students.
  • High standards of behaviour, a professional attitude and commitment to quality service.
  • Ability to work cooperatively with other Dental Assistant Instructors, students and staff.
  • Ability to consider and respond appropriately to the needs, feelings and capabilities of students, to provide feedback and treat students equitably.

title: Registered Massage Therapist RMT
description:
Considering a change and just checking out what other practice locations are out there? Or perhaps trying to decide where to start up your career? We invite you to take 2 minutes to read this post as some food for thought.


Yes, Hand and Stone Burlington is a big location, we have 7 treatment rooms offering Registered Massage Therapy, and that takes a certain amount of staff. For some, this is not a fit, and we understand, but please allow us to share a different perspective.
Hand and Stone Burlington is easily one of, if not the number one, go to place for Registered Massage Therapy in Burlington and surrounding areas. We've been in the community for nearly 10 years and have a great reputation (Google us to be sure). Clients know they have access to a variety of providers with various techniques and strengths, so having different staff to find their match with is a huge asset and brings them in to us. Additionally, clients know they can call and get in to see an RMT within 24 hours when needed, be it for an acute or nagging concern, to relieve accumulating stress, or spoil themselves, so that means you will see variety in your day.
Yes, we're a busy location, BUT, we're a busy location. You can let go of that stress of having to market yourself, or worry whether you will make the income you require, or be bored day after day, week after week without being able to do what you trained hard to become. That would be kind of nice, wouldn't it?
So, why not give us a call and find out a bit more. Not every location is run by the same owner, and this one is not like the others.  There's a reason we're the number ONE Spa, year after year.
 
We have all kinds of other stuff to tell you about how you can make up to $1400 per week, before gratuities, working 25 appointments, or how our computer system lets you check your schedule or make notes from your phone, or how if you're a new grad you can get your CMTO and licensing fees paid for up front, or how we'll pay you to learn Himalayan salt stone and hot stone treatments, decompression therapy/cupping, prenatal massage and lots more, as well as tons of other great stuff, but you'll need to reach out first. A phone conversation with us just might be the change you're looking for. 
If you're not an RMT yet, and are nervous about completing your licensing tests (MCQ and OSCE), we can help you with that too.  We are partnered with a great company that offers a prep course to help you succeed, and we pay for this course for you - a $475 value.  Just reach out to us to learn how.  We want to support you and see you succeed.

What it's like to work at Hand & Stone Burlington:
-Start your day with a friendly smile from out front desk team and a quick covid screen (done for all staff everyday to ensure your safety),
-review your clients on our computers, tablets, or your phone,
-take your client from our lobby to your treatment room,
-perform your unique massage treatment,
-sign the insurance receipt that has been prepared for you in a folder at the front desk,
-remake the table (with help from our cleaning team when possible) using linens stocked in the room for you,
-leave the used linens in laundry bins where they are laundered, folded and restocked in the treatment room for you,
-make a treatment note (again from your phone, tablet, or computer), and
-collect your next client (or head home, if it's the end of your day). 

That's it.  Your clients are booked, welcomed, prescreened, rebooked, and invoiced for you by our front desk team that care deeply about customer service, without any additional charges or deductions from your pay.
If you're a new grad, there's also a 7 step program to support your growth and practice as a new RMT for 1 full YEAR by one of our in-house coach/mentor/trainers.  They answer any questions you have as you navigate challenges and new situations that come with starting out as an RMT.  This is the program that also pays for up to $1000.00 of your registration fees.

Here's a bunch of other stuff that we're supposed to say and that is important...

Just so you know, we are on top of everything; we follow strict COVID-19 safety, cleaning and disinfecting protocols for our Spa, so everyone will feel safe in our environment. PPE and all cleaning and disinfecting materials are provided for you and clients must sign a pre-screen clearance and waiver prior to treatment.  It is a priority to support our team so that their days canrun smoothly. 

We believe in creating an inclusive and uplifting environment for everyone at Hand & Stone with trust and respect as our guide.We look forward to speaking with you and sharing how we work diligently to create a safe and healthy environment for everyone.  
QUALIFICATIONS:• Current Massage Therapy registration with the CMTO
• Reliable, confident and effective communication• Passionate, nurturing and caring disposition


#HSBurlington

I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (PT)
description:
Thought you know about Massage Heights? Think again!
Make $6000 more year over year! $50,000 - $100,000

In the Past:  
  • Back to back appointments only
  • No recommendations for Tx plans
  • Average pay $38/50 minutes
  • Some benefits
  • Some partnerships
  • Paper SOAP note files
  • Earn basic commissions
  • Only Full time could be promoted
  • Promotions could be earned after 1 year
  • No employee assistance program
  • Benefits through Manulife
  • Spa-like environment
  • Booking the schedule at 80% full

New and improved! 
  • Choose back-to-back appointments or 15 minute breaks.
  • Training and support available for recommended Tx plans.
  • Average pay $45/50 minutes
  • Health benefits Plus Additional Reimbursements
  • Partnerships for Discounts with Seminars for Health and lululemon!
  • Tablets for SOAP notes including voice to text
  • Earn basic commissions plus additional earnings
  • Part time and Full time can earn promotions
  • Promotions can be earned after 6 months
  • Employee assistance program (Free counselling and more over the phone!)
  • Benefits through Sunlife (Medical, Dental, Prescription)
  • Spa-clinic fusion, spa setting with clinical approach to Treatments
  • Booking the schedule at 95% full 

Tried and True:
  • Consistent and predictable client base (our front desk team ensures you are busy) 
  • $10-$20 gratuities per session on average
  • $750 reimbursement benefit for your Association Registration each year
  • $600 reimbursement benefit towards self-care, such as for spa or gym memberships, yoga, spin classes, etc.!!
  • $300 reimbursement benefit towards Continuing Education Courses each year (such as Dynamic Cupping, Prenatal, Stretching, Lymphatic Drainage, Advanced Orthopedic, etc.!!)
  • Vacation Pay 
  • Stat Pay 
  • Hydraulic massage tables and anti-fatigue flooring (Save your body & prolong your career)
  • Being a part of a team environment alongside other licensed therapists
  • Receiving free hands-on RMT training 
  • No administration responsibilities
  • All supplies are provided (No need to pay extra for linens, lotions, cleaning, rent, or admin staff)
  • Share your passion for helping people through massage therapy!

Massage Heights is the place for you!

We are taking every consideration to ensure the health and safety of our guests and staff. Our measures include providing optional masks, hand sanitizer, upgrading our cleaning measures, and integrating technology such as texting for guest arrival.

How to apply: Please send your Resume to Megan Bester at

mbester@massageheights.ca

description:
SOMMAIRE

DESCRIPTION
- Effectuer les fonctions d’un massothérapeute selon ses capacités professionnelles en collaboration avec les thérapeutes;
- Travailler de concert avec le personnel d’une équipe multidisciplinaire afin d’optimiser les soins et services offerts aux patients.


EXIGENCES
- Membre en règle d’une association reconnue;
- Formation reconnue par les associations de massothérapeutes;
- Massage thérapeutique;
- Motivé à développer sa clientèle;
- Bilingue français/anglais;
- Intérêt à travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire.
- Avoir complété 1000 heures de formation (massothérapeute et non praticien en massage)

HORAIRE
- Le candidat doit être disponible pour travailler 2 jours, soit un total de 8 heures par semaine.
- Doit être disponible le soir et/ou le samedi
- À déterminer selon les disponibilités du massothérapeute et les besoins de la clinique;


Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé afin d’alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

Clinic : Mascouche (2705 Chemin Ste-Marie bur 201, Mascouche, (Qc) J7K 1M8)

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Nexus Massage & Rehab is a multi-disciplinary clinic located at busy Yonge and Eglinton. Our clinic offers a collaboration of massage therapy, chiropractic, physiotherapy, acupuncture and osteopathy to help patients achieve the their Optimal Self!
 
Nexus was founded by a Chiropractor and a RMT who understands the hard work that you do. We are a dynamic, fun, loving team who are looking for a driven, and motivated RMT to join our thriving team! 

  • What our patients say about us: https://goo.gl/maps/7EKy5TrVUNt
  • Check out our Team: https://nexushealthclinic.com/team
  • Learn about our story: https://nexushealthclinic.com/about-us

Why work at Nexus:
  • Health Allowances so you can get treated and take care of your own body (*subject to approval)
  • On-going training and one-on-one mentorship with the clinic owners who focus on YOUR GROWTH as a healthcare professional and entrepreneur. You will learn different skills to improve on treatments and how to build a strong caseload.
  • Monthly Clinic Rounds where practitioners learn and teach diagnostic and treatment techniques.
  • Opportunity to be a part of an external Practice Acceleration Program with top Canadian practitioners to grow your caseload and generate better patient outcomes.
  • Treatment Exchanges! We love to learn from each other's techniques and as a bonus, you will have an opportunity to exchange treatments with each other.
  •  Financial Rewards Plan to increase your earning potential. 
  •  Team Building Events where we have FUN together! We have quarterly team building eventsto encourage practitioners to de-stress and let loose!
 
ADDITIONAL PERKS:
  • A busy location at Yonge and Eglinton, with lots of restaurants
  • Mentorship in caseload building
  • Flexible schedules and hours
  • Laundry and receptionist service
  • Electronic medical records (paperless)
  • State of the art equipment and supplies provided

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
SNAPSHOT:

Quality Care Sports Injury & Rehab is a top-rated clinic (4.9/5 Google rating) serving Oakville patients for over 31 years. Our services include Physiotherapy, Pelvic Physiotherapy, Chiropractic, Athletic Therapy, and Active Living and our focus is on one-on-one premium care with private-pay patients. We are currently looking for a hardworking Registered Massage Therapist to join the Quality Care team of highly-skilled practitioners. We are looking for a strong candidate to help grow our practice with us by being the go-to RMT at our clinic.

WHAT QUALITY CARE SPORTS INJURY IS LOOKING FOR FOR IN A HIRE:

  • Hungry to build their book and growth further via social media, community outreach to local businesses, Dental office or Orthotic business relations, or calling RMT patients to sell RMT services;
  • Leadership abilities - driver of business, not a passive practitioner;
  • Friendly and outgoing personality;
  • Great customer service skills;
  • Great organizational skills;
  • Multitasking and time-management skills;
  • Ability to work independently and be proactive with ideas and implementation.

WHY YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN WORKING AT QUALITY CARE SPORTS INJURY & REHAB:

  • Thousands of patients from our 31 years of top notch service;
  • High performing team with almost >97% book back rates;
  • Private-pay patients who are loyal to their practitioners;
  • Opportunity to own equity based on future performance;
  • Immediate profit share for new client acquisition and product sales;
  • Marketing support to go alongside your own outreach and full time front desk to help you manage patient load;
  • Jane booking system and sophisticated reporting and billing to keep things organized;
  • Our team is very friendly and responsive, so you get to enjoy autonomy, while also having the benefit of a supportive team behind you;
  • Top-rated clinic with satisfied patients and positive team morale;
  • Option for hourly or % pay models.

CLINICAL:

  • Assessing, reassessing, and treating patients - own/lead their care plans with the collaboration of the team to ensure the best patient outcomes
  • Emailing past patients to check-in, ask about injuries, sending exercise/stretch video links to be helpful, while letting people know you are here
  • Blogs/posts - optional not required - great candidates will have a propensity to write helpful communications


Wellness Impact Partners is a health and wellness recruiting agency that works on behalf of its clients in finding top candidates across Canada. For more information visit


Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Registered RMT in good standing with the College of RMTs of Ontario;
  • Proof of double vaccination;
  • Willing to contact patients directly to confirm rebooking;
  • Personal protective equipment provided and required to be worn including sanitizing, disinfecting, cleaning procedures, and social distancing in place;
  • Flawless written and verbal communication in English.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Join our team that is revolutionizing the rehab industry in Ottawa. We are like-minded individuals who bring their passion to inspire and empower the community to take care of their bodies and change their lifestyles. We are more than a therapy and wellness company; we are a people company. Together we have created a culture that provides everyone with the opportunity to initiate change and grow both on the professional and individual level. We have developed this through joint collaborations including mentorships and internal educational seminars.
 
As Vitality Massage Therapist, we believe you must have the passion to constantly grow and expand your knowledge and skill set. We currently have 3 clinics with plans of growth and expansion, with more opportunities to come. We are an award-winning team with currently the highest rated clinics on Google reviews in Ottawa with over 600+, 5-star reviews and have won the Consumers Choice and Top Choice Awards for best physiotherapy and wellness clinic.
 
Your Commitment:
  • Understand the Vitality philosophy and deliver an exceptional client experience
  • Follow the clinics' processes and operations to provide the Vitality experience
  • Effectively understand the client’s medical history, symptoms, and long-term goals to focus on longevity
  • Develop and communicate clearly personalized treatment plans for each client based on their ultimate goals and their “why”
  • Accurately document as per college guideline client’s condition and progress
  • Build relationships with other staff and thrive within the culture
  • Build strong rapport with clients from a variety of backgrounds through strong communication and providing the Vitality experience
  • Understand how to quickly implement new technology and software changes in the ever-changing industry to enhance client engagement
  • Participate in community development initiatives to drive branding awareness and new assessments.
  • Participate in on-going clinical education (internal and external)
  • In coordination with the clinic director, review compliance and performance to determine the level of support and training required to help you grow.

Your Profile:
  • Licensed and in good standing with CMTO
  • Appropriate liability insurance
  • Flexibility to work mornings, evenings and/or weekends
  • Strong communication skills and engagement
  • Wants to explore and grow with the team with clear career planning

Why Vitality?

We live our values and are in the pursuit of excellence in everything we do. We believe in a fair compensation philosophy.
 
  • Signing Bonus ($)
  • Fee-split ($)
  • Career Pathways (Planning)
  • 5 Assessments per week to build your caseload ($)  Full Case Load Available
  • Regular Support in building and maintaining your caseload ($)
  • Paid subscription (approx. $200) to clinician education site Embodia ($)
  • Vacation pay ($)
  • Paid time off for self-care, family/friends, travel ($)
  • Paid onboarding and training ($)
  • Company sponsored team dinners and Quarterly appreciation events ($)
  • Other perks (see below)
  • No admin work! We manage all reception, appointment, invoicing, and billing for you
  • Laundry all done for you
  • Remote access for online charting
 
Career progression OPTIONS:
  • Focus on your clinical work and be a super-star therapist for your patients
  • Diversify your clinical work and get involved in the business side of things
 
We believe in MENTORSHIP! 
 
Whether you are a seasoned clinician or a new grad, we help you plan your certification and (new) programs to sharpen and add new skills to your clinical tool-kit. As clinicians our learning never ends.
 
How does it work? 
  • You will meet monthly with a Lead RMT
  • Practice new and advance techniques to build and sharpen your skills
  • Course and certification planning and roadmap
  • Get help to build a full caseload and maintain it
  • How to create a treatment plan and keep patients committed to it so they graduate and get their outcomes/why
 
Contact me if you have the same CORE VALUES:
  • Empowering together 
  • Re-inventing experiences    
  • Authenticity
  • Integrity
  • Celebrating the wellbeing and success of every person
  • The Pursuit of excellence
 
Well, you’ve kept reading. That’s great! Here are some more perks our RMTs have requested and received:
  • Extra hours available ($)
  • Personal branding for referrals
  • Collaborations with other brands
  • State of the art equipment
  • Remote access to documentation
  • Company retreats
 
Take Action! If you admire who we are and believe in our vision, and are ready to roll up your sleeves and grow, we’d love to meet you.





    About Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre:

    The rehabilitation industry has been around for years, however, it has not progressed and evolved to keep up with patients’ needs. Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre has patient needs, quality service, and overall client experience as its core values. This is the change the industry needed.When looking for a new clinic, patients may face a daunting experience, filled with unknowns. Not knowing what to expect or what the path to recovery might look like can take a toll on patients. This can sometimes limit patients from finding the right health care professional and delay their recovery. In order to help patients in their path to recovery, our founder understood this and wanted to transform the industry.Here’s the story of how Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to be the revolutionary industry leader it is today: In 2016, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre founder and registered physiotherapist Andrew Istefanos learned that the physiotherapy industry operated using outdated procedures. From his experience working in various clinics in the Greater Toronto Area, he learned that these outdated procedures were the industry norm. Andrew quickly realized that his patient-centered approach helped his patients achieve true wellness.. He believed collaborative care including physiotherapy and massage therapy was meant to be personal, one-on-one, and integrated. Developing a system with individualized treatments influenced by advanced clinical research including manual therapy and movement based exercises, Andrew quickly started to define the future of rehab. This approach created an environment that encouraged dialogue with patients and noted their needs and wants. As a result of this dialogue, it became clear that patients wanted an elevated experience, available in luxurious spaces with private rooms and an open-concept gym with state of the art equipment. With these founding principles, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to life.
