title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)

Our award-winning multidisciplinary clinic is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to join our growing team.

Are you a team player who is great at building relationships and passionate about helping others? If so, we want you to join our dynamic group of healthcare professionals.  Our therapists are Burnaby's leading back, knee, and neck pain specialists, and dedicated to helping our patients get back to living a life they love.  As our Registered Massage Therapist, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills and learn from top physicians in a multidisciplinary clinic environment.

Responsibilities

  • Provide 30, 45, and 60-minute deep tissue, relaxation, and pre/post-natal massages using techniques such as myofascial release, trigger point release, and joint mobilization
  • Execute clinical assessments and implement treatment plans for clients
  • Monitor client progress and provide ongoing evaluation
  • Communicate important information and educate clients on treatment strategies
  • Keep accurate, up-to-date clinical records
  • Work with other therapists and external stakeholders as needed
  • Participate in continuous learning to further enhance skills
  • Ability to work through situations with professionalism and confidentiality

Skills and Experience

  • Registered member and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of BC (CMTBC)
  • Massage Therapy Certification from College of Massage Therapy diploma program
  • Experience and/or interest in pre-and post-natal massage
  • Relevant experience is an asset
  • New graduates are welcome to apply

Hours

Hours are flexible and can be discussed in-person

About Royal Treatment Therapeutics

Located in South Burnaby, Royal Treatment Therapeutics is a multidisciplinary wellness centre passionate about outstanding patient care.  We offer a variety of services including massage therapy, physiotherapy, chiropractic, acupuncture, Traditional Chinese Medicine, and more.  All our practitioners are registered in their respective fields and dedicated to providing exceptional care in a warm and welcoming environment.  Whether a patient is seeking pain relief, stress reduction, or relaxation, we make it our mission to provide the "royal treatment" at our award-winning clinic.

Why work with Us

  • Comprehensive and competitive compensation package
  • Flexible work schedules so you can set your own hours
  • Access to our portfolio of clients
  • A multidisciplinary team who refers patients internally to other therapists
  • Full-time reception and billing services
  • Online booking with Jane App allows you to see your schedule from anywhere
  • Benefit from our in-house marketing team with digital and print ads promoting you and your services
  • All supplies provided including on-site linen and laundry services

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
About Us


We are a group of Award-Winning Boutique Wellness Clinics located in Canada and the Caribbean. Our focus is Preventative Health, and we work with top medical practitioners to offer services that are aimed at healthy living. We bridge the gap between traditional and alternative medicine to help prevent, heal, and manage the disease while boosting vitality. Our clinics deliver a multi-faceted approach to optimizing your health and slowing down aging, including a variety of health and beauty products and services. We were one of the first clinics in Canada to truly embrace and execute the concept of integrative care through cross-collaboration and building synergies amongst various practitioners. We are now in our 9th year of operations and look forward to many more.

We currently own and operate the following clinics. For more information about us and our clinics please visit â€“ www.thewellnesscorp.ca

  • BeWell @ Clarkson Health Clinic, South Mississauga 
  • BeWell @ Hamilton Health Clinic, Corktown â€“ Hamilton
  • BeWell Health Clinic, Toronto
  • EatWell Health Centre, Toronto
  • Simcoe Place Health Clinic, Toronto
  • Vitality Medical Clinic, Punta Cana

BeWell Health Clinic is a multidisciplinary health clinic led by Psychiatrists, the team is comprised of MDs, Psychologists, Psychotherapists, Social Workers, Naturopathic Doctors, Acupuncturists, Mindfulness & Breath Coaches, RMTs, and many more all housed in one state of the art facility. Our model of care is truly integrative where all practitioners work closely with each other to reach the best patient outcomes. 

The Role

The clinic offers an excellent work environment. Our client base consists mainly of professionals from surrounding companies, most of whom are looking for deep tissue massage from a knowledgeable therapist. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered care and are looking for someone who is friendly and able to quickly build rapport. We are committed to quality patient-centered care, leading clinical practices, and collaborative teamwork. We are supportive, respectful, caring, and accountable toward our patients and staff.

Main job duties would be as follows:

  • Provide therapeutic massages to patients by appointments
  • Review patientâ€™s medical history and note any medical conditions
  • Determine the type of massage best suited for the patient.
  • Provide appropriate treatment to the patients based on their needs, goals, and preferences.
  • Communicate warmly, effectively, positively, and professionally with patients.
  • Utilizing e-charting software to document treatment sessions and recommendations.
  • Collaborating with the inter-professional team at the clinic
  • Managing caseload in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead clients through individualized care plans - accurately assessing, communicating, and providing hands-on treatment to facilitate goal attainment for the client.
  • Engage in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Advise clients of stretching, strengthening or relaxation methods
  • work closely with other practitioners and are motivated to grow their practice.

Qualification

  • Must be registered and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Excellent clinical knowledge
  • Create a custom treatment plan for each patient -inclusive of maintenance programs when necessary
  • Friendly with exceptional interpersonal skills, build rapport quickly
  • Educate patients on other services provided by the Clinic
  • Stays up to date on new techniques and relevant offerings
  • Reliable professional with a strong work ethic

Why Us?

  • Competitive split OR base salary offered while you grow your practice.
  • All supplies provided by the Clinic (linens, oil/lotions/gel)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Large existing practice
  • Great Administrative support
  • Warm and personable team-based atmosphere
  • A fast-growing company with lots of growth potential
  • Lumino Health Marketing provided
  • Complimentary services at the clinic ($2000 value)
  • Skincare and wellness products at cost (Hello SkinCeuticals!!)

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
Thank you for your interest in the RMT position with Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spas located at 1615 Orleans Blvd., Orleans, Ontario. We have listened to concerns of RMTs in the industry and have created a new, lucrative compensation model, that provides a predictable and consistent income that you can count on.

In addition to our new compensation package, we offer:·         A bonus structure that pays the RMT's professional registration and insurance fees on a yearly basis for full time.·         Paid professional development including courses in Hot & Cold Stone Therapy, Decompression Cupping Therapy and more. All of our courses are to support some of an RMT’s learning requirements for the new CMTO STRiVE program.  

As before, we offer:·         Health Benefits for full time employees
·         Contractor or Employee options·         Flexible full time and part time hours and schedules·         Paid training on massage therapy modalities·         Opportunity to earn extra income with modalities and shift premiums·         PPE provided
·         Team atmosphere·         State of the art equipment
·         Administrative support and more...

Talk to us to find out why more and more RMTs are working at Hand & Stone.  We look forward to meeting you soon.#HSOrleans

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with an independently owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee, a separate company and employer from H&S Massage Spa Canada Corporation and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

title: Registered Massage Therapist Calgary
description:
Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Contract - 0.4 FTE

Location: TELUS Health - Care Centres

Join our team

TELUS Health - Care Centres is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to support our Centre. We also are open to working with individuals that are interested in any of our sites, including Edmonton, Vancouver and North Vancouver.

This position provides an exciting, “lifestyle friendly” opportunity in a dynamic setting. We are certain that you will find the organization provides a welcoming and progressive workplace and we are deeply committed to introducing innovations in healthcare delivery for the benefit of our clients. Within this role, the Massage Therapists play a key role in our team environment. If you are eager to develop professionally, diversify and grow your client base, contribute to expanding the business and continuously market the Centre, we are looking for you.

Here's how

As part of the team, you'll be responsible for:

  • Performing clinical assessments, setting goals and providing treatment plans for clients
  • Initiating appropriate treatment intervention based on clinical assessment
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information
  • Participating in quality improvement initiatives
  • Collaborating with our interdisciplinary healthcare team
  • Communicating to appropriate referral sources and stakeholders

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Experience / Knowledge:

  • 2200 hours of training or equivalent
  • Three to five years’ experience in healthcare setting utilizing health charting
  • Proficient in assessment and treatment planning
  • Knowledge and proficiency in various massage therapy techniques (therapeutic, relaxation and pregnancy are assets)

Skills and Abilities:

  • Outstanding customer and massage services
  • Punctual, and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an interdisciplinary team environment
  • Computer competency and familiarity with an EMR - MedAccess

Professional / Designation Certification:

  • Registered with the College of Massage Therapists of Alberta RMT association and in good standing
  • Graduate from an accredited school of massage

Work Conditions / Physical Requirements:

  • You will be working in a multi-disciplinary clinical setting. Typical office hours throughout weekdays only, however, some flexibility may be required to accommodate service requirements for the operation to extend outside of standard business hours during these days.
  • Physical strength, endurance and overall health is of utmost importance to perform the job consistently and effectively throughout the week as most of the day will require multiple hours of standing, pressing, lunging or bending as well as stretching or assisting clients;
  • You will be working in an office environment, which may require extended periods of time completing computer related work in between treatments. You will work an eight hour day with an additional minimum of half hour for lunch as well as a scheduled 15 minute break between clients to allow for timely changeover and sanitization of room and equipment.

Who is TELUS Health - Care Centres?

We are a national network of renowned medical professionals dedicated to identifying health risks, inspiring positive lifestyle choices and improving patient outcomes. We have one of the largest networks of Care Centres in Canada.

Our commitment: Better healthcare options for everyone. We are leveraging the power of technology to provide Canadians with better health outcomes. Connecting health teams, streamlining workflows, and empowering patients to manage their health are just some of the ways our digital solutions promote collaboration and efficiency.

We are looking for enthusiastic, customer service minded individuals who want to work in a collaborative, friendly and supportive environment. Join our team and help us shape the future of how Canadians engage with the healthcare ecosystem.

Accessibility

TELUS Health is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process. Please let the recruitment team know of any accommodation requirement at the beginning of the process.

Please note that we are exclusively recruiting people who can work legally in Canada.

If you meet the qualifications and feel you can help achieve excellence in the quality of care we provide, we would be very interested in talking to you. Please submit your resume and cover letter on our website, https://www.telus.com/en/health/care-centres, under the Careers tab.

Thank you!

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, we will only contact with those selected for an interview.

title: Mokara Spa Toronto- Registered Massage Therapist Full-time)
description:
Overview / vue gÃƒ ©nÃƒ ©rale:

King Edward Hotel

 

With its rich history, timeless elegance, and modern hospitality, the Omni King Edward Hotel has been a favourite of both locals and visitors for over 110 years. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, this landmark hotel is just steps away from a wealth of diverse restaurants, tourist hotspots, and shopping centres.   It's no wonder the Omni King Edward is the perfect destination for business and leisure travellers alike.  


The Omni King Edward Hotel's associates enjoy a dynamic and exciting work environment, comprehensive training and mentoring, along with the pride that comes from working for a company with a reputation for exceptional service. We embody a culture of respect, gratitude and empowerment day in and day out. If you are a friendly, motivated person, with a passion to serve others, the Omni King Edward Hotel may be your perfect match

Job Description / description de l'emploi:

Join Canada's first Mokara Spa at the Omni King Edward Hotel!   $400.00 - Signing Bonus  

 

Perform massage treatment plan based on guestâ€™s medical assessment, needs and concerns.    Provide efficient service and create memorable experiences by exceeding guest expectations.  

Qualifications / qualifications:
  • Must be registered and in good standing with College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Practice various massage therapy modalities, including but not limited to Swedish Massage, Deep Tissue Massage, and Prenatal Massage
  • Strong communication skills  
  • Must speak English fluently
  • Must be guest-service oriented, team player, positive and friendly

 

Whatâ€™s in it for me?

  • Both part time and full time position available  
  • Total Compensation: $55 - $70 per hour  
  • Flexible hours: Wednesday to Sunday
  • Tuition reimbursement for continuing education  
  • Growth opportunities
  • Benefit package  
  • Uniforms provided
  • Spacious treatment rooms equipped with hydraulic tables, warmer, hot towel cabbies, sound system and dimmable lights  
  • Centrally located in the financial district, one block each of King subway station  

 

Responsibilities / responsabilitÃƒ ©s:
  • Assess and propose the most effective treatment plan for guests within the time booked  
  • Administer the appropriate pressue and massage techniques for the respective condition while monitoring guest's comfort level  
  • Ensure that all guests receive an exceptional and positive spa experience  
  • Following treatment, provide expert advice, including but not limited to self care instructions that may help the guest's wellbeing
  • Document guest's condition and progress following each treatment

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic clinic have been serving the GTA for more than 17 years. We are located in the NW area of Markham, only a few minutes from Thornhill, North York, Scarborough and Richmond Hill. We have a superb reputation for our thorough and caring approach.

We are looking for a Part-time or Full-Time professional registered Massage therapist (RMT) to join our wellness team.

The Clinic has extensive rehab equipment. (ie. Adjustable Massage Table,Massage Chair, hydrocollator, Infrared Light Therapy, etc. (see below for more information)

We see mostly private cases but also see MVA & WSIB patients. Direct Billing available too.

1 room, 2 rooms or whole clinic rental, or % options available.

Please call &/or email to discuss further.

(See below for more Information about Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic)

Associate, Rental & Ownership Options

Clinic already has the following on site:
  • Atlas Chiropractic Software
  • Triton Spinal Decompression Table
  • BTL Ultrasound/IFC/TENS
  • Hydrocollator (moist heat pads)
  • Whole Body Vibration Machine
  • Infrared Light Therapy
  • Light and Pain Control Therapy
  • Laser Therapy
  • nterSegmental Traction

The clinic is already set up with extensive rehab equipment and more including:
  • Wobble chairs (x4)
  • 2-way neck traction (x4)
  • Repetitive neck traction (x3)
  • Inversion (x1) and Rebounder (x1)
  • Posture pumps
  • Dennerolls and Fulcrums
  • 3 Drop Tables and 4 Therapy Tables
  • Massage Table (x1) and Massage Chair

About Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic:
  • Over 17 Years Quality Service
  • Lots of Free Parking
  • Equipment Rental & Library
  • Sell Devices & Supplements

7315 Woodbine Ave., Markham Ontario L3R 3V7
www.wellnessfirst.ca wellnessfirstfamily@gmail.com
Call us today to set up a meeting or visit the clinic
(905) 477-6578

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Job description

WHAT WE DO

Integracareâ€™s dedicated and exceptional team of Caregivers provide extraordinary care, which fosters client independence and joyful living in their chosen environment. We are seeking Registered Massage Therapists for private care in the community (1 to 1 care with flexibility to work weekdays, weekends and evenings).

WHAT OUR TEAM IS SAYING

  • â€œIntegracare is like a familyâ€

SKILLS REQUIRED

  • For â€œin the homeâ€ assessments and treatments.
  • Referrals will be generated by Integracare.
  • Community Physiotherapist will be able to treat clients (generally Seniors) with a wide range of acute, chronic and pre and post op conditions.

Qualifications

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
SUMMARY
This function is responsible for the assessment of patients and the provision of
appropriate massage treatment based on examination findings. The massage service
provided, will be based on the therapists’ clinical knowledge, training and expertise and
delivered in accordance with the guidelines and clinical quality standards established by
Complete Rehabilitation.

COMPENSATION
70/30 split

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 
  • Performs intake assessments of new patients booked into his/her schedule; 
  • Provides appropriate massage treatment techniques for all scheduled patients based on assessment and reassessment findings; 
  • Maintains the patient chart as for College requirements 
  • Provides external communication as required by jurisdictional / regulatory requirements and stakeholder needs. 
  • Must be a team player with a positive work ethic that excels in providing clients with the ultimate clinic experience 
  • Perform various types of massage therapy including, but not limited to: therapeutic, sports, deep tissue, relaxation, pregnancy, and hot stone. 
  • Perform massages in varying time increments including: 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 60 minutes. 
  • Communicates directly with the referring physician if a problem arises regarding the patient’s progress, participation in the Complete Rehabilitation treatment, rehabilitation program, or return to work/ADL plan; 
  • Participation in the provision of Complete Rehabilitation and Complete 
  • Performance Centre patient education programs as required; 
  • Prepares medical legal reports when requested to do so; 
  • Completes necessary insurance documents to facilitate reimbursement of fees to patients; 
  • Lectures, promotes and markets to groups outside of Complete Rehabilitation when delegated to do so by the Clinic Manager; 
  • Performs a timely examination of the patient, ensures the provision of first aid or arranges for emergency medical care, if required, and documents the event, if a patient is involved in an “incident” while participating in a Complete Rehabilitation treatment program; 
  • Keeps up to date with all the emergency plans and evacuation procedure for his/her clinic location and participates in regular practice drills; • Provides professional services to other Complete Rehabilitation clinics when required; 
  • Upgrades his/her clinical skills through participation in continuing education. 
 
QUALIFICATIONS: 
  • Must be a Registered Massage Therapist and a member of the College of 
  • Massage Therapists of Ontario 
  • Holds a current license to practice valid for the province where he/she is employed; 
  • Holds current professional liability insurance coverage; 
  • Ability to work as part of a team and demonstrate team leadership; 
  • Ability to communicate well internally and externally; 
  • Able to demonstrate empathy with patients; 
  • Strong organizational, time-management and problem solving skills. 

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Must be a Registered Massage Therapist and a member of the College of Massage
Therapists of Ontario.
 
LANGUAGE SKILLS
English Mandatory

COMPENSATION
70/30 split

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Love helping people? We're looking for diverse and equity minded passionate, hardworking, and self-directed people to join our team of caregivers. Spark Inc is an innovative and award-winning inclusive and equity focused organization that matches diverse clients to the best one to one care in the community.  

 
REGISTERED MASSAGE THERAPIST
Our clients are looking for Massage Therapy Services in the Ottawa area. We are looking for Registered Massage Therapists to provide treatment  in our Centretown clinic and/or mobile therapy. Team-oriented Registered Massage Therapists who have interests in helping people with complex cases would be the best fit.  

We are excited to work with you because: 

  • You appreciate a tech forward workplace.
  • You have demonstrated skills and interest in clinical treatment.
  • You are interested in working collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team.
  • You are a team player who wants to improve people's lives. 
 
HOURS
Flexible scheduling available with individual control over booking clients
 
RATE OF PAY
70% of all billables
Additional paid travel time for mobile treatments

Requirements:

  • Registration in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario
  • Proof of Professional Liability Insurance (minimum of $2 million) 
  • If interested in mobile therapy, a valid driver's license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong time management skills, ability to work independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Demonstrated understanding and adherence to appropriate community health regulations

Why Spark?

  • Competitive compensation as well as frequent and repeat clientele
  • Flexible caseload and independent management over your own schedule 
  • Guaranteed monthly pay
  • Access and coverage to Jane for online booking, billing, and digital charting for a 100% paperless experience
  • Direct billing capabilities 
  • Experience working within the MVA (motor vehicle accident) system and competitive compensation with free access to HCAI
  • On-site laundry and linens 
  • Hydraulic tables 
  • Access to Care Specialists with expertise in a variety of areas, including business development and tax management, chronic pain, brain injury as well as diversity and equity.
  • Supportive full-time administrative team
  • Clients to complement existing practice and clientele

We would love to hear from new graduates! 

 

Therapy is tailored to each person, so each position is unique. Whatever the circumstances, we want people who will genuinely care about their wellbeing.

At Spark, we value community, work life balance and career development. To help foster your personal and professional growth, we partner with Spark University, a non-profit focused on connecting, educating, and empowering caregivers. Spark U provides you with learning opportunities to make sure you are providing quality care for your clients. You can check them out at www.sparku.ca

Whatever our clients' age, background, or circumstances, we help them choose the perfect fit from our handpicked team of passionate, skilled and committed care providers. As a care provider with Spark, you have a voice in the matching process. We believe that your input will foster the best long-term relationships with your clients. At Spark, you'll have flexibility, autonomy and a team who truly cares about you.

Whatever your age, ability, orientation, ethnicity, race, culture, religion or gender identity - you are welcome. Our community is stronger and more vibrant when it is more diverse.

Check us out: www.sparkcares.ca

title: Registered Massage Therapist - TPT - Transitions & Integrated Care- Work-Fit
description:
The Work-Fit Total Therapy Centre

Posting #: 2021- 878231

Position: Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Temporary Part-time for approx. 1 year (Must provide availability of a 0.5 FTE)

Hours: Various shifts -Mon - Sun --- Days & Evenings ---7.5 hour shifts

Department: Transitions & Integrated Care- Work-Fit

Site: Primarily based in Georgetown (could cover Oakville and Milton if are able)

The Work-Fit Total Therapy Centre is a multi-disciplinary clinic serving residents of Oakville, Milton, Georgetown and the surrounding community.With three locations - Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital,Milton District Hospital and Georgetown Hospital - our experienced health care professionals work together to deliver the best possible care.Clinics are staffed with fully qualified and experienced professionals including Registered Physiotherapists, Registered Massage Therapists and Chiropractors. We are currently seeking a Registered Massage Therapist for our Oakville and Milton location s . While we cannot guarantee the total number of clients, we will work in conjunction with you to market your services throughout the hospital(s).

Why Halton Healthcare?

  • You’ll be provided with clerical support for client bookings/cancellations and payment processing
  • Creative marketing and promotional support provided
  • Opportunity to work with multiple health professionals to ensure exemplary patient care always
  • Access to professional development through education sessions, workshops and collaboration at the hospital

This is what you'll be doing:

The ideal RMT candidate will bring with them experience and live locally within theHalton area and have the ability to treat painful ailments, decompress tired and overworked muscles, reduce stress, rehabilitate sports injuries, and promote general health. Must be able to provide appropriate treatment for clients based on their needs, goals and preferences .

This is what you'll need to do it:

  • Must be registered in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario.
  • Must be in good standing with and have a Certificate of Registration from the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (the College).
  • Current C.P.R. and First Aid Training
  • Minimum 2 years of clinical work experience
  • Excellent communication, documentation and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to participate as a member of the team
  • Self motivated and demonstrated ability to manage a busy and varied caseload
  • Demonstrated exceptional organizational skills
  • Must be a team player
  • Must have $2 million commercial liability and professional liability insurance

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we'd like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

Date Posted: June 3, 2021

Internal applications due by :June 10, 2021

We thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.Halton Healthcare is a smoke-free facility in and around all three sites.

Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
MYo Lab Health & Wellness Inc. is a small business in Calgary, AB. We are bold, social, and customer-centric, and our goal is to provide elite multidisciplinary healthcare to the community.

Our work environment includes:
  • Safe work environment
  • Growth opportunities
  • On-the-job training

Are you looking for an upgrade to your Massage career? Tired of the typical go with the flow clinic setting and desire more clear direction, mentorship and training to take your practice to the next level? Do you strive to be one of the greatest RMTs in Calgary and beyond?

If so, we at MYo Lab Health & Wellness want to meet you!

At MYo Lab you will be surrounded by like-minded professionals with the common goal of providing the best possible service to our members. You will be supported in weekly 1:1 meetings, role-play opportunities, access to elite coaching from around the world, research reviews and more. At MYo we operate as a team, with a member-first core value to best ensure every member gets the same excellent experience; as such, MYo operates under the idea that if you do something once, a system is needed to ensure it is done consistently to the best possible outcome by everyone on the team. If this is something you find restrictive, MYo may not be the best fit for you.

Base salary & incentive plan provided, as well as a health spending account or education fund.

Benefits
  • Extended health care
  • Dental care
  • Vision care
  • Paid time off
  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Wellness program
  • Profit sharing
  • Company events
  • On-site gym
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Store discount

Schedule Options (Please be sure to include in your application which options you desire):
OPTION 1: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays= OFF; Tuesdays @1-9pm; Wednesdays @12:30-2pm Team Meeting + 2-9pm; Thursdays @1-9pm

= 31 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 32.5 Total Hours over 4 days/week

OPTION 2: Sundays= OFF; Mondays @1-9pm; Tuesdays @1-9pm; Wednesdays @12:30-2pm Team Meeting + 2-9 pm; Thursdays @1-9pm
= 31 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 32.5 Total Hours over 4 days/week

OPTION 3: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays @5:30-9pm; Tuesdays: 1-9pm; Wednesday @10-7pm (12:30-2pm Team Meeting); Thursdays @1-9pm
= 35 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 36.5 Total Hours over 5 days/week

OPTION 4: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays @1-9pm; Tuesdays @10 - 6pm; Wednesdays @12:30-9pm (12:30-2pm Team Meeting); Thursdays @5:30-9pm
*
= 34.5 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 36 Total Hours over 5 days/week*
If this is exactly what you've been looking for please submit your resume and a personalized CV to tell us more about yourself, your aspirations, and why you responded to this ad. Also, please provide information regarding your desired start date and schedule (please review the hours listed on our website/Google to determine).

If you are still reading this you are already more driven and determined than the average and we are excited to hear from you!

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Founded in 2002, Vida Spas offer uniquely luxurious, personalized traditional and healing spa experiences including treatments based on the ancient Indian science of Ayurveda.  With four locations currently serving clients in Vancouver and Whistler, we are always looking for talent to join our Vida family. Vida Spa believes in sustainable growth by cultivating wellness from the inside out. www.vidaspas.com
 
Our Values:
  • We are mindful.  We are present in everything we do.  Every employee and guest feel listened to and taken care of.
  • We are open.  Everyone is an individual with different needs.  We respect and honor individuals, their beliefs, and their practices.
  • We live by example demonstrating a healthy approach to life.
  • We perform our best every day.  Excellence in what we do is the enabler for Vida to grow its business and to touch and affect more people.
  • We are committed to learning.  Ongoing learning is the key to positive change and the cultivation of overall health.
 
We are currently recruiting for Vida Spa at the Fairmont Chateau Whistler.
 
Job Description: Massage Therapist 
 
Profile:
An individual committed to surpassing our valued guest’s expectations.  As a Therapist, the individual must perform massages with attention to quality, detail, and service performance.  This individual must also embrace & promote Vida Spa's philosophy of a positive and healthy work environment.
 
Skills Required:
  • Strong technical skills, listening skills, and communication skills.  Please note - A practical exam will also be conducted
  • A positive and optimistic attitude with a passion for the Wellness industry- a true team player
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Perform your role to the best of your ability while demonstrating five-star customer service to all guests.
  • Perform your role with a positive attitude at all times.
  • Adhere strictly to the Vida Spa Hygiene Protocols.
  • Adhere strictly to Vida Spa Massage Manual.
  • Between your massage treatments, assist with stocking and removal of linen

There are many benefits to working with Vida, which include:
  • Discounts on Spa retail, and services
  • Competitive Wage
  • Extended Medical – (Vida covers 50% of the monthly premiums) (only available to those who work 32hrs+)
  • Reimbursement for ski passes (For those who work 32hr + as well)
  • Oscars - the FCW Employee Café allows Vida staff to purchase meal cards at $5 per meal ticket. 
  • A supportive team-working environment
 
If you feel you possess Vida’s philosophy, we ask that you send in your resume to the below email address.
 
Apply To:  Bonnie@vidaspas.com
Please note only qualified candidates will be contacted

title: Spa Manager
description:
BE THE DIFFERENCE and enjoy a successful career in Massage Therapy at Hand & Stone - Peterborough located at 999 Lansdowne Street Peterborough, ON K9J 8N2. Hand & Stone Spa Managers lead and motivate a team of RMTs, Estheticians and Spa Associates to provide outstanding client services and reach or exceed sales goals. Spa Managers are dynamic, dedicated and enthusiastic leaders that seek out team training opportunities, implement client service programs and establish efficient processes that empower the team to achieve an outstanding client experience. REQUIREMENTS
  • Lead, coach, train and set expectations for a team of spa service professionals
  • Demonstrate ability to balance coaching with discipline
  • Deliver outstanding client experiences in spa services and retail operations
  • Manage, coach and train team on selling spa services and products to reach or exceed financial goals
  • Manage, coach and train team on cost management best practices
  • Manage administrative tasks including but not limited to payroll, scheduling, inventory and reporting

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Minimum 2 years experience in spa or hospitality management
  • Excellent knowledge of spa services and retail operations
  • Ability to meet or exceed sales goals
  • Ability to meet or exceed cost of goods sold goals
  • Strong desire to provide, train and deliver outstanding customer service
  • Deep knowledge and understanding of spa services and product line with strong capacity to sell these to clients
  • Ability to work flexible schedule including days / evenings / weekends / split shifts and holidays 

BENEFITS & PERKS
  • Competitive pay structure inclusive of commissions & bonuses
  • Steady clientele for RMTs and Estheticians
  • Flexible schedules to fit your life
  • In-depth orientation and follow-up in-house training (approved for CEU’s)
  • All supplies provided – just show up!
  • Spacious, well-stocked treatment rooms with state-of-the-art equipment
  • Uplifting team atmosphere
  

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with an independently owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee, a separate company and employer from H&S Massage Spa Canada Corporation and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Thought you know about Massage Heights? Think again!

Make $6000 more year over year! $50,000 - $100,000
 
In the Past: 
  • Back to back appointments only
  • No recommendations for Tx plans
  • Average pay $38/50 minutes
  • Some benefits
  • Some partnerships
  • Paper SOAP note files
  • Earn basic commissions
  • Only Full time could be promoted
  • Promotions could be earned after 1 year
  • No employee assistance program
  • Benefits through Manulife
  • Spa-like environment
  • Booking the schedule at 80% full

New and improved! 
  • Choose back-to-back appointments or 15 minute breaks.
  • Training and support available for recommended Tx plans.
  • Average pay $45/50 minutes
  • Health benefits Plus Additional Reimbursements
  • Partnerships for Discounts with Seminars for Health and lululemon!
  • Tablets for SOAP notes including voice to text
  • Earn basic commissions plus additional earnings
  • Part time and Full time can earn promotions
  • Promotions can be earned after 6 months
  • Employee assistance program (Free counselling and more over the phone!)
  • Benefits through Sunlife (Medical, Dental, Prescription)
  • Spa-clinic fusion, spa setting with clinical approach to Treatments
  • Booking the schedule at 95% full

Tried and True:
  • Consistent and predictable client base (our front desk team ensures you are busy) 
  • $10-$20 gratuities per session on average
  • $750 reimbursement benefit for your Association Registration each year
  • $600 reimbursement benefit towards self-care, such as for spa or gym memberships, yoga, spin classes, etc.!!
  • $300 reimbursement benefit towards Continuing Education Courses each year (such as Dynamic Cupping, Prenatal, Stretching, Lymphatic Drainage, Advanced Orthopedic, etc.!!)
  • Vacation Pay 
  • Stat Pay 
  • Hydraulic massage tables and anti-fatigue flooring (Save your body & prolong your career)
  • Being a part of a team environment alongside other licensed therapists
  • Receiving free hands-on RMT training 
  • No administration responsibilities
  • All supplies are provided (No need to pay extra for linens, lotions, cleaning, rent, or admin staff)
  • Share your passion for helping people through massage therapy!

Massage Heights is the place for you!

We are taking every consideration to ensure the health and safety of our guests and staff. Our measures include providing optional masks, hand sanitizer, upgrading our cleaning measures, and integrating technology such as texting for guest arrival.

How to apply: Please send your Resume to Megan Bester at

mbester@massageheights.ca

company: Hand & Stone - Barrie North & Barrie South
description:
Thank you for your interest in the RMT position with Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa located at Barrie North Crossing Mall in North Barrie, Ontario. We're open and looking for professional and dynamic Registered Massage Therapists to join our Barrie team.
We have new COVID-19 safety, cleaning and disinfecting protocols for our Spa, so our employees will feel confident returning to a safe work place and be able to treat clients effectively while doing what they love.  PPE and all cleaning and disinfecting materials are provided for and clients must sign a pre-screen clearance and waiver prior to treatment.  We provide our team the support that is needed to help their day run smoothly.     As before, we will be offering:
  • Employee or contractor options
  • Significant earnings bonus opportunity for full time hours
  • Flexible part time and full time hours and schedules 
  • Paid training on new protocols
  • Evening and weekend shift premium
  • Health benefits for full time employees
  • Safe, supportive atmosphere
  • PPE provided for all employees
  • And more
We look forward to speaking with you and sharing how we work diligently to create a safe and healthy environment for everyone.  QUALIFICATIONS:• Current Certificate of Registration with the CMTO
• Dedicated health professional• Reliable, confident and effective communication• Self-motivated and strong decision making skills• Passionate, nurturing and caring disposition#HSBarrieNorth

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with an independently owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee, a separate company and employer from H&S Massage Spa Canada Corporation and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
BE THE DIFFERENCE and enjoy a successful career in Massage Therapy at Hand & Stone - Peterborough located at 999 Lansdowne Street Peterborough, ON K9J 8N2.

New Graduates. Ask us about our new 7 Steps to Success Graduate Program for RMTs. A great foundation to help build your career.


At Hand & Stone we are proud of our unique environment where: 
• RMTs have the opportunity to grow professionally and have a successful and predictable massage therapy practice 
• RMTs can be trained as Coaches or RMT Trainers and share their knowledge with each other as they work in a     supportive environment making a difference for their clients and to new RMTs 
• Work in a team atmosphere that offers paid training and educational opportunities 
• Schedules are offered to RMTs that vary from one day to 5 days per week, employee with Health-Care benefits or contractor, your choice

We asked and you told us what matters to an RMT – Let’s work together to create the work environment that suits you personally, the options are endless. Apply today. QUALIFICATIONS:
  •  Current Massage Therapy Registration with the CMTO
  •  Dedicated health professional
  •  Reliable, confident and effective communication
  •  Self-motivated and strong decision making skills
  •  Passionate, nurturing and caring disposition

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedules to meet your work-life balance
  • Immediate client base with loyal and valued clients
  • Access to online booking system – ease of monitoring your schedule from your phone
  • Comprehensive and competitive compensation package – with Predictable bi-weekly income
  • Optional health-care benefits package
  • Allowance for professional development and training
  • We provide all supplies, billing, booking services as well as full-time reception coverage.
Responsibilities:
 
  •  Performing high-quality treatments with a complete focus on the client
  •  Maintaining a strong collaborative working relationship with team members.
  •  Recommending home care
  •  Maintaining accurate client records


 

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with an independently owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee, a separate company and employer from H&S Massage Spa Canada Corporation and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

title: Massothérapeute / Massage Therapist
description:
SOMMAIRE
Clinique :Repentigny (450 Notre-Dame suite 100, Repentigny, (Qc) J6A 2T4)
Horaire : à déterminer
Statut : consultant


DESCRIPTION
- Effectuer les fonctions d’un massothérapeute selon ses capacités professionnelles en collaboration avec les thérapeutes;
- Travailler de concert avec le personnel d’une équipe multidisciplinaire afin d’optimiser les soins et services offerts aux patients.


EXIGENCES
- Membre en règle d’une association reconnue;
- Formation reconnue par les associations de massothérapeutes;
- Massage thérapeutique;
- Motivé à développer sa clientèle;
- Bilingue français/anglais;
- Intérêt à travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire.
- Avoir complété 1000 heures de formation (massothérapeute et non praticien en massage)


HORAIRE
- Environ 10 à 15 heures/semaine
- Doit être disponible le soir et/ou le samedi
- À déterminer selon les disponibilités du massothérapeute et les besoins de la clinique;



Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé afin d’alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.


===================================

SUMMARY

Clinic :Repentigny (450 Notre-Dame suite 100, Repentigny, (Qc) J6A 2T4)
Schedule : To be determined
Status : Consultant

DESCRIPTION
- Perform the functions of a massage therapist according to her professional abilities in collaboration with the therapists;
- Work with the staff of a multidisciplinary team to optimize patient care and services.


REQUIREMENTS
- Member in good standing of a recognized association;
- Training recognized by the massage therapists associations;
- Therapeutic massage;
- Motivated to develop the clientele;
- Bilingual French/English;
- Interest in working in a multidisciplinary environment.


SCHEDULE
- Candidate should be available to work between 10 to 15 hours per week
- Must be available evening and/or Saturdays
- To be determined according to the availability of the massage therapist and the needs of the clinic;


Please note that the masculine is used to simplify the text, without prejudice to the feminine form.


- Être membre en règle ou futur membre de l’Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ); - Connaissance du logiciel ClinicMaster (atout); - Intérêt à travailler avec une clientèle privée, CNESST et SAAQ; - Intérêt à travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire; - Bilingue français/anglais. - Be a member in good standing or future member of the Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ); - Knowledge of ClinicMaster (asset); - Interest in working in a private sector, CNESST and SAAQ; - Interest in working in a multidisciplinary environment; - Bilingual French/English (asset).

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Join our team that is revolutionizing the rehab industry in Ottawa. We are like-minded individuals who bring their passion to inspire and empower the community to take care of their bodies and change their lifestyles. We are more than a therapy and wellness company; we are a people company. Together we have created a culture that provides everyone with the opportunity to initiate change and grow both on the professional and individual level. We have developed this through joint collaborations including mentorships and internal educational seminars.

As Vitality Massage Therapists, we believe you must have the passion to constantly grow and expand your knowledge and skill set. We currently have 3 clinics with plans of growth and expansion, with more opportunities to come. We are an award-winning team with currently the highest rated clinics on Google reviews in Ottawa with over 600+, 5-star reviews and have won the Consumers Choice and Top Choice Awards for best physiotherapy and wellness clinic.

Your Commitment:
  • Understand the Vitality philosophy and deliver an exceptional client experience.
  • Follow the clinics' processes and operations to provide the Vitality experience.
  • Effectively understand the client’s medical history, symptoms, and long-term goals to focus on longevity.
  • Develop and communicate clearly personalized treatment plans for each client based on their ultimate goals and their “why”.
  • Accurately document as per college guideline client’s condition and progress.
  • Build relationships with other staff and thrive within the culture.
  • Build strong rapport with clients from a variety of backgrounds through strong communication and providing the Vitality experience.
  • Understand how to quickly implement new technology and software changes in the ever-changing industry to enhance client engagement.
  • Participate in community development initiatives to drive branding awareness and new assessments.
  • Participate in ongoing clinical education (internal and external).
  • In coordination with the clinic director, review compliance and performance to determine the level of support and training required to help you grow.

Your Profile:
  • Licensed and in good standing with CMTO.
  • Appropriate liability insurance.
  • Flexibility to work mornings, evenings and/or weekends.
  • Strong communication skills and engagement.
  • Wants to explore and grow with the team with clear career planning.

Why Vitality?
We live our values and are in the pursuit of excellence in everything we do. We believe in a fair compensation philosophy.
  • Signing Bonus ($)
  • Fee-split ($)
  • Career Pathways (Planning)
  • 5 Assessments per week to build your caseload ($) Full Case Load Available**
  • Regular Support in building and maintaining your caseload ($)
  • Paid subscription (approx. $200) to clinician education site Embodia ($)
  • Vacation pay ($)
  • Paid time off for self-care, family/friends, travel ($)
  • Paid onboarding and training ($)
  • Company-sponsored team dinners and Quarterly appreciation events ($)
  • Other perks (see below)
  • No admin work! We manage all reception, appointment, invoicing, and billing for you.
  • Laundry all done for you.
  • Remote access for online charting.
Career progression OPTIONS:
  • Focus on your clinical work and be a super-star therapist for your patients
  • Diversify your clinical work and get involved in the business side of things
We believe in MENTORSHIP!
Whether you are a seasoned clinician or a new grad, we help you plan your certification and (new) programs to sharpen and add new skills to your clinical toolkit. As clinicians our learning never ends.

How does it work?
  • You will meet monthly with a Lead RMT.
  • Practice new and advance techniques to build and sharpen your skills.
  • Course and certification planning and roadmap.
  • Get help to build a full caseload and maintain it.
  • How to create a treatment plan and keep patients committed to it so they graduate and get their outcomes/why.
Contact me if you have the same CORE VALUES:
  • Empowering together
  • Re-inventing experiences
  • Authenticity
  • Integrity
  • Celebrating the wellbeing and success of every person
  • The Pursuit of excellence
Well, you’ve kept reading. That’s great! Here are some more perks our RMTs have requested and received:
  • Extra hours available ($)
  • Personal branding for referrals.
  • Collaborations with other brands.
  • State of the art equipment.
  • Remote access to documentation.
Take Action! If you admire who we are and believe in our vision, and are ready to roll up your sleeves and grow, we’d love to meet you.




    About Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre:

    The rehabilitation industry has been around for years, however, it has not progressed and evolved to keep up with patients’ needs. Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre has patient needs, quality service, and overall client experience as its core values. This is the change the industry needed.When looking for a new clinic, patients may face a daunting experience, filled with unknowns. Not knowing what to expect or what the path to recovery might look like can take a toll on patients. This can sometimes limit patients from finding the right health care professional and delay their recovery. In order to help patients in their path to recovery, our founder understood this and wanted to transform the industry.Here’s the story of how Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to be the revolutionary industry leader it is today: In 2016, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre founder and registered physiotherapist Andrew Istefanos learned that the physiotherapy industry operated using outdated procedures. From his experience working in various clinics in the Greater Toronto Area, he learned that these outdated procedures were the industry norm. Andrew quickly realized that his patient-centered approach helped his patients achieve true wellness.. He believed collaborative care including physiotherapy and massage therapy was meant to be personal, one-on-one, and integrated. Developing a system with individualized treatments influenced by advanced clinical research including manual therapy and movement based exercises, Andrew quickly started to define the future of rehab. This approach created an environment that encouraged dialogue with patients and noted their needs and wants. As a result of this dialogue, it became clear that patients wanted an elevated experience, available in luxurious spaces with private rooms and an open-concept gym with state of the art equipment. With these founding principles, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to life.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
About Us


We are a group of Award-Winning Boutique Wellness Clinics located in Canada and the Caribbean. Our focus is Preventative Health, and we work with top medical practitioners to offer services that are aimed at healthy living. We bridge the gap between traditional and alternative medicine to help prevent, heal, and manage the disease while boosting vitality. Our clinics deliver a multi-faceted approach to optimizing your health and slowing down aging, including a variety of health and beauty products and services. We were one of the first clinics in Canada to truly embrace and execute the concept of integrative care through cross-collaboration and building synergies amongst various practitioners. We are now in our 9th year of operations and look forward to many more.

We currently own and operate the following clinics. For more information about us and our clinics please visit â€“ www.thewellnesscorp.ca

  • BeWell @ Clarkson Health Clinic, South Mississauga 
  • BeWell @ Hamilton Health Clinic, Corktown â€“ Hamilton
  • BeWell Health Clinic, Toronto
  • EatWell Health Centre, Toronto
  • Simcoe Place Health Clinic, Toronto
  • Vitality Medical Clinic, Punta Cana

BeWell Health Clinic is a multidisciplinary health clinic led by Psychiatrists, the team is comprised of MDs, Psychologists, Psychotherapists, Social Workers, Naturopathic Doctors, Acupuncturists, Mindfulness & Breath Coaches, RMTs, and many more all housed in one state of the art facility. Our model of care is truly integrative where all practitioners work closely with each other to reach the best patient outcomes. 

The Role

The clinic offers an excellent work environment. Our client base consists mainly of professionals from surrounding companies, most of whom are looking for deep tissue massage from a knowledgeable therapist. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered care and are looking for someone who is friendly and able to quickly build rapport. We are committed to quality patient-centered care, leading clinical practices, and collaborative teamwork. We are supportive, respectful, caring, and accountable toward our patients and staff.

Main job duties would be as follows:

  • Provide therapeutic massages to patients by appointments
  • Review patientâ€™s medical history and note any medical conditions
  • Determine the type of massage best suited for the patient.
  • Provide appropriate treatment to the patients based on their needs, goals, and preferences.
  • Communicate warmly, effectively, positively, and professionally with patients.
  • Utilizing e-charting software to document treatment sessions and recommendations.
  • Collaborating with the inter-professional team at the clinic
  • Managing caseload in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead clients through individualized care plans - accurately assessing, communicating, and providing hands-on treatment to facilitate goal attainment for the client.
  • Engage in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Advise clients of stretching, strengthening or relaxation methods
  • work closely with other practitioners and are motivated to grow their practice.

Qualification

  • Must be registered and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Excellent clinical knowledge
  • Create a custom treatment plan for each patient -inclusive of maintenance programs when necessary
  • Friendly with exceptional interpersonal skills, build rapport quickly
  • Educate patients on other services provided by the Clinic
  • Stays up to date on new techniques and relevant offerings
  • Reliable professional with a strong work ethic

Why Us?

  • Competitive split OR base salary offered while you grow your practice.
  • All supplies provided by the Clinic (linens, oil/lotions/gel)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Large existing practice
  • Great Administrative support
  • Warm and personable team-based atmosphere
  • A fast-growing company with lots of growth potential
  • Lumino Health Marketing provided
  • Complimentary services at the clinic ($2000 value)
  • Skincare and wellness products at cost (Hello SkinCeuticals!!)

title: Massage Therapist - (Job Number: CAL002229)
description:
Description

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A part time registered massage therapist



Stillwater Spa at the Hyatt Regency Calgary strives to be the top choice for spa enthusiasts for our unparalleled level of service and expertise. We aspire to be top of mind for colleagues who wish to reach their highest potential and grow their careers by establishing a company culture that enriches our team members to be their best!



What is exepcted of me in this role

  • Follow Stillwater Service Standards upon hiring
  • Perform Therapeutic, Relaxation and Prenatal Massage in a safe and professional manner
  • As per Association, mandate SOAP notes are to be documented for every massage service.
  • Educate guests on products and homecare
  • Maintain professional manner and positive attitude with guests and co-workers
  • Maintain current professional licenses and association memberships
  • Keep current on trends in Massage Therapy and Spa industry.
  • Available to work on Saturday and Sunday from 1030 am to 7pm

Qualifications

experience and qualifications

  • Minimum of 2 years massage experience
  • Graduated from a 2200 massage therapy program
  • Valid City of Calgary Massage Business License
  • Valid Membership to a recognized massage association


WHAT ARE THE ADDITIONAL BENEFITS TO WORKING AT THE HYATT REGENCY CALGARY?

  • Complimentary meal during shift
  • Discounts at Thomsons Kitchen/Bar
  • Discounts on Stillwater Spa Services and Spa Products
  • Paid medical days
  • Employer RRSP Matching Contributions
  • Discounted Parking
  • Complimentary hotel nights and Friends and Family discounts at Hyatt properties around the world
  • Complimentary access to our pool and Stay Fit Gym
  • Tuition reimbursement program

FIND YOUR PLACE AT HYATT


Be a part of something bigger. Enjoy life every day. Make a difference in the lives of those around you. Love where you work. Join a family that values respect, integrity, humility, empathy, creativity and fun, your perfect opportunity.



At Hyatt, diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of our purpose,to care for people so they can be their best.


We welcome colleagues and guests from all over the worldand we know that bringing diverse perspectives and underrepresented voices into the conversation strengthens our organization. There is no room for racism, discrimination or hatred of any kind at Hyatt hotels or offices.



This role will typically allow a minimum of 10 hours per week



Visit careers.hyatt.com to apply


Primary Location: CA-AB-Calgary
Organization: Hyatt Regency Calgary
Pay Basis: Hourly
Job Level: Hourly/Entry Level Employee
Job: Spa

title: Registered Massage Therapist Vancouver
description:
Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Part Time

Location: TELUS Health - Care Centres

Join our team

TELUS Health - Care Centres is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to support our Centre. We also are open to working with individuals that are interested in any of our sites, including Edmonton, Vancouver and North Vancouver.

This position provides an exciting, “lifestyle friendly” opportunity in a dynamic setting. We are certain that you will find the organization provides a welcoming and progressive workplace and we are deeply committed to introducing innovations in healthcare delivery for the benefit of our clients. Within this role, the Massage Therapists play a key role in our team environment. If you are eager to develop professionally, diversify and grow your client base, contribute to expanding the business and continuously market the Centre, we are looking for you.

Here's how

As part of the team, you'll be responsible for:

  • Performing clinical assessments, setting goals and providing treatment plans for clients
  • Initiating appropriate treatment intervention based on clinical assessment
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information
  • Participating in quality improvement initiatives
  • Collaborating with our interdisciplinary healthcare team
  • Communicating to appropriate referral sources and stakeholders

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Experience / Knowledge:

  • 2200 hours of training or equivalent
  • Three to five years’ experience in healthcare setting utilizing health charting
  • Proficient in assessment and treatment planning
  • Knowledge and proficiency in various massage therapy techniques (therapeutic, relaxation and pregnancy are assets)

Skills and Abilities:

  • Outstanding customer and massage services
  • Punctual, and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an interdisciplinary team environment
  • Computer competency and familiarity with an EMR - MedAccess

Professional / Designation Certification:

  • Registered with the College of Massage Therapists of Alberta RMT association and in good standing
  • Graduate from an accredited school of massage

Work Conditions / Physical Requirements:

  • You will be working in a multi-disciplinary clinical setting. Typical office hours throughout weekdays only, however, some flexibility may be required to accommodate service requirements for the operation to extend outside of standard business hours during these days.
  • Physical strength, endurance and overall health is of utmost importance to perform the job consistently and effectively throughout the week as most of the day will require multiple hours of standing, pressing, lunging or bending as well as stretching or assisting clients;
  • You will be working in an office environment, which may require extended periods of time completing computer related work in between treatments. You will work an eight hour day with an additional minimum of half hour for lunch as well as a scheduled 15 minute break between clients to allow for timely changeover and sanitization of room and equipment.

Who is TELUS Health - Care Centres?

We are a national network of renowned medical professionals dedicated to identifying health risks, inspiring positive lifestyle choices and improving patient outcomes. We have one of the largest networks of Care Centres in Canada.

Our commitment: Better healthcare options for everyone. We are leveraging the power of technology to provide Canadians with better health outcomes. Connecting health teams, streamlining workflows, and empowering patients to manage their health are just some of the ways our digital solutions promote collaboration and efficiency.

We are looking for enthusiastic, customer service minded individuals who want to work in a collaborative, friendly and supportive environment. Join our team and help us shape the future of how Canadians engage with the healthcare ecosystem.

Accessibility

TELUS Health is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process. Please let the recruitment team know of any accommodation requirement at the beginning of the process.

Please note that we are exclusively recruiting people who can work legally in Canada.

If you meet the qualifications and feel you can help achieve excellence in the quality of care we provide, we would be very interested in talking to you. Please submit your resume and cover letter on our website, https://www.telus.com/en/health/care-centres, under the Careers tab.

Thank you!

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, we will only contact with those selected for an interview.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic clinic have been serving the GTA for more than 17 years. We are located in the NW area of Markham, only a few minutes from Thornhill, North York, Scarborough and Richmond Hill. We have a superb reputation for our thorough and caring approach.

We are looking for a Part-time or Full-Time professional registered Massage therapist (RMT) to join our wellness team.

The Clinic has extensive rehab equipment. (ie. Adjustable Massage Table,Massage Chair, hydrocollator, Infrared Light Therapy, etc. (see below for more information)

We see mostly private cases but also see MVA & WSIB patients. Direct Billing available too.

1 room, 2 rooms or whole clinic rental, or % options available.

Please call &/or email to discuss further.

(See below for more Information about Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic)

Associate, Rental & Ownership Options

Clinic already has the following on site:
  • Atlas Chiropractic Software
  • Triton Spinal Decompression Table
  • BTL Ultrasound/IFC/TENS
  • Hydrocollator (moist heat pads)
  • Whole Body Vibration Machine
  • Infrared Light Therapy
  • Light and Pain Control Therapy
  • Laser Therapy
  • nterSegmental Traction

The clinic is already set up with extensive rehab equipment and more including:
  • Wobble chairs (x4)
  • 2-way neck traction (x4)
  • Repetitive neck traction (x3)
  • Inversion (x1) and Rebounder (x1)
  • Posture pumps
  • Dennerolls and Fulcrums
  • 3 Drop Tables and 4 Therapy Tables
  • Massage Table (x1) and Massage Chair

About Wellness First Physiotherapy and Chiropractic:
  • Over 17 Years Quality Service
  • Lots of Free Parking
  • Equipment Rental & Library
  • Sell Devices & Supplements

7315 Woodbine Ave., Markham Ontario L3R 3V7
www.wellnessfirst.ca wellnessfirstfamily@gmail.com
Call us today to set up a meeting or visit the clinic
(905) 477-6578

title: Registered Massage Therapist - TPT - Transitions & Integrated Care- Work-Fit
description:
The Work-Fit Total Therapy Centre

Posting #: 2021-878229

Position: Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Temporary Part-time for approx. 1 year (Must provide availability of a 0.5 FTE)

Hours: Various shifts -Mon - Sun --- Days & Evenings ---7.5 hour shifts

Department: Transitions & Integrated Care- Work-Fit

Site: Primarily based inMilton (could cover Oakville andGeorgetown if are able)

The Work-Fit Total Therapy Centre is a multi-disciplinary clinic serving residents of Oakville, Milton, Georgetown and the surrounding community.With three locations - Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital,Milton District Hospital and Georgetown Hospital - our experienced health care professionals work together to deliver the best possible care.Clinics are staffed with fully qualified and experienced professionals including Registered Physiotherapists, Registered Massage Therapists and Chiropractors. We are currently seeking a Registered Massage Therapist for our Oakville and Milton location s . While we cannot guarantee the total number of clients, we will work in conjunction with you to market your services throughout the hospital(s).

Why Halton Healthcare?

  • You’ll be provided with clerical support for client bookings/cancellations and payment processing
  • Creative marketing and promotional support provided
  • Opportunity to work with multiple health professionals to ensure exemplary patient care always
  • Access to professional development through education sessions, workshops and collaboration at the hospital

This is what you'll be doing:

The ideal RMT candidate will bring with them experience and live locally within theHalton area and have the ability to treat painful ailments, decompress tired and overworked muscles, reduce stress, rehabilitate sports injuries, and promote general health. Must be able to provide appropriate treatment for clients based on their needs, goals and preferences .

This is what you'll need to do it:

  • Must be registered in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario.
  • Must be in good standing with and have a Certificate of Registration from the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (the College).
  • Current C.P.R. and First Aid Training
  • Minimum 2 years of clinical work experience
  • Excellent communication, documentation and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to participate as a member of the team
  • Self motivated and demonstrated ability to manage a busy and varied caseload
  • Demonstrated exceptional organizational skills
  • Must be a team player
  • Must have $2 million commercial liability and professional liability insurance

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we'd like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

Date Posted: June 3, 2021

Internal applications due by :June 10, 2021

We thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.Halton Healthcare is a smoke-free facility in and around all three sites.

Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Founded in 2002, Vida Spas offer uniquely luxurious, personalized traditional and healing spa experiences including treatments based on the ancient Indian science of Ayurveda.  With three locations currently serving clients in Vancouver and Whistler, we are always looking for talent to join our Vida family. Vida Spa believes in sustainable growth by cultivating wellness from the inside out. www.vidaspas.com
 
Our Values
We are mindful. We are present in everything we do. Every employee and guest feel listened to and taken care of.
We are open. Everyone is an individual with different needs. We respect and honor individuals, their beliefs, and their practices.
We live by example demonstrating a healthy approach to life.
We perform our best every day. Excellence in what we do is the enabler for Vida to grow its business and to touch and affect more people.
We are committed to learning. Ongoing learning is the key to positive change and the cultivation of overall health.
 
We are currently recruiting for Vida Spa at the: 
The Sutton Place and Westin Bayshore Hotel.
 
Job Description:
Registered Massage Therapist.
 
You are a spa professional passionate about wellness. You are looking for balance of mind and body in your work environment. You want an environment that manifests positive energy and a team with the same vision. You want an employer that treats you fairly and looks out for your own wellness. 
 
We offer an exciting and supportive atmosphere that encourages learning and nurtures relationships. We are looking for compassionate, open individuals who embrace our philosophy.

Benefits include:
We match clinic wages plus gratuities on average 15-20 %, we offer extended medical benefits, potential housing at fair and affordable rates, a $1000 signing bonus (minimum 3 shifts taken until March 30th).

An opportunity to experience treatments yourself at nominal fees, subsidized meals in the hotel cafeteria, and the opportunity to work for other Vida locations in the off-season.
 
If you feel you possess Vida’s philosophy, we ask that you confirm your availability by replying to this email at a suitable time.
 
Apply To:

Yuka@vidaspas.com
