title: Mobile Massage Therapist
description:
Receive $300-500 STARTING BONUS when you join our team. (amount depends on # of years of experience).

Job type: Contract, Part-time, Full-time

Salary: $ 54-65 / hour +tips

Schedule: Flexible - MINIMUM of 20 massages/month (up to 30-35)

Areas to cover: Island of Montreal ( Westmount, Hampstead, Downtown, TMR, Griffintown St Henri, Old Port, Cote St Luc).

What we offer:

  • flexibility in schedule and days off
  • growth opportunities
  • casual work attire
  • safe work environment
  • large online presence where you can share your self-care tips
  • steady client flow
  • independence

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Have a professional training diploma in a minimum of two of the following: Swedish, Californian, deep tissue, sport, prenatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, lymphatic drainage, acupressure
  • Be a member of a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Must have a mode of transportation and all equipment to massage (massage table, sheets, oil)
  • Be self-employed and able to issue receipts

Qualities required:

  • reliable, punctual
  • excellent team spirit
  • respects confidentiality
  • excited to grow a clientele with us
  • loves to work with people

Bonus: If you have a Reiki certification

Blu Wellbeing Inc. is a reputable brand known for the ultimate mobile massage experience. Our company is holistic based purposed to inspire our community to selfcare daily. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram: @bluwellbeing)

We are looking for a dynamic person with recognized training. A trustworthy person, zen, warm and above all passionate about massage therapy.

If you are looking to make great pay, have a steady clientele, be a part of a beautiful team environment all while maintaining your work independent, then Blu Wellbeing is for you.

—————————-

Recevez un BONUS de départ de 300 à 500 $ lorsque vous rejoignez notre équipe. (le montant dépend du nombre d'années d'expérience).

Type d'emploi: Contrat, Temps partiel, Temps plein

Salaire: 54-65 $ / heure + pourboires

Horaire: Flexible - MINIMUM de 20 massages/mois (maximum: 30-35)

Zones à couvrir: Île de Montréal (Westmount, Hampstead, Centre-ville, St Henri, Vieux-Port, Côte St Luc, Griffintown).

Ce que nous offrons:

- flexibilité dans les horaires et les jours de congé

- opportunités de croissance

- tenue de travail décontractée

- environnement de travail sécuritaire

- grande présence en ligne où vous pouvez partager vos conseils d'auto-soins

- flux de clients stable

CONDITIONS:

- Avoir un diplôme de formation professionnelle dans au moins deux des disciplines suivantes : suédois, californien, tissus profonds, sport, prénatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, drainage lymphatique, acupression

- Être membre d'une association de massothérapie reconnue.

- Doit avoir un moyen de transport et tout le matériel pour masser (table de massage, draps, huile)

- Être travailleur autonome et pouvoir délivrer des reçus

Qualités requises :

- fiable, ponctuel

- excellent esprit d'équipe

- respecte la confidentialité

- ravi de développer une clientèle avec nous

- aime travailler avec les gens

Bonus : Si vous avez une certification Reiki

Blu Wellbeing Inc. est une marque réputée connue pour l'expérience de massage mobile ultime. Notre entreprise est basée sur une approche holistique et vise à inspirer notre communauté à prendre soin de soi au quotidien. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram : @bluwellbeing)

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique avec une formation reconnue. Une personne de confiance, zen, chaleureuse et surtout passionnée de massothérapie.

Si vous cherchez à gagner un bon salaire, à avoir une clientèle stable, à faire partie d'un bel environnement d'équipe tout en conservant votre indépendance de travail, alors Blu Wellbeing est fait pour vous.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $54.00-$65.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Application question(s):

  • What do you know about our company, Blu Wellbeing?
  • What is your massage therapy experience?

Expected start date: 2022-05-13

title: Registered Massage Therapist RMT
description:
Registered Massage Therapy in a Essential Services Health and Wellness Environment.

Features and Benefits at Ste. Anne’s

Ste. Anne’s mission is to bring the power of healing, through human touch, to the world. The vision: To Nurture the Human Spirit with good food, personal care, spa treatments and an amazing environment. The Values: R.E.S.P.E.C.T. Recognize & Enthusiastically Support People to Encourage Compassion and Tolerance. The Goal: To provide every guest with an absolutely incredible and unforgettable experience. These are all to keep true to the Prophecy: I have chosen this beautiful garden, where I will send many people to be healed. Taken from a prophecy about Ste. Anne’s by, Jay Rawlings

Aside from enjoying the beautiful environment in the Northumberland hills overlooking Lake Ontario, you can work with a group of healing professionals who embrace lifelong learning and growth.

The culture is a healing caring and nurturing environment with strong spirit of social justice. Employees are welcome are provided with a discount on services, accommodations and products.

Wages are evaluated by department with the marketplace regularly to ensure we have competitive compensation packages that allow the staff to live comfortable rewarding lives. We also offer a Compassionate Assistance Plan which is designed to provide meaningful and timely help to those within the Ste. Anne’s family who are enduring an emergency or hardship. We do not want to see our staff in a tough financial situation for any reason.

Ste. Anne’s has been around for 30 years but is still in a growth mode, recently launching its all natural product line and opening a gluten free bakery onsite. Plans for growth and expansion are always being considered, meaning opportunities for advancement are available. All full time employees are entitled to benefits including, drugs, medical, paramedical, dental and vision.

A summary of benefits available to Ste. Anne’s Employees

  • Life and Dependent Life Insurance
  • Accidental Death and Dismemberment
  • Out of Country
  • Drug Coverage
  • Health Benefits
  • Extended Health (Paramedical), Massage, Shiatsu, Accupuncture, Naturopathic, Chiropractic, Physiotherapy, and more
  • Medical Cannabis funding
  • Vision
  • Dental
  • Use of onsite Gym
  • Service discounts – 20% Product discounts – 20%

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $31.00-$39.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site gym
  • Store discount
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (required)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Refined Health & Wellness would like to welcome a career-driven practitioner to our growing team of health professionals and enthusiasts. If you are a Registered Massage Therapist who is looking for a platform to elevate your practice, you have come to the right place!

Our position is open to both Registered Massage Therapists as well as Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training!

At Refined, we work as a cohesive group to manage the operational aspects of the clinic, and because we share in the responsibilities associated with reception, laundry, and clinic upkeep, our practitioners are eligible to earn commissions exceeding 70%.

Our mentorship and guidance program will provide you with training in the areas of direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, and much more!

As a valued member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work alongside other passionate and like-minded practitioners who have an affinity for their craft and who love what they do. Through collaboration and inter-referrals, you will be able to establish a strong and resilient practice.

Our clinic is outfitted with the highest quality amenities and equipment, ensuring that nothing will hold you back from offering the best possible experiences to your clients. Our treatment rooms are large with big, beautiful windows that overlook the Sturgeon River Valley!

Make Refined Health & Wellness the place where you can set the roots of your practice and explore your passions in the health and wellness disciplines!

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS

  • Starting commission of 65% with opportunities for advancement.
  • 'Bonus Pay Program' that offers additional percentage top-ups, providing practitioners the opportunity to earn commissions exceeding 70%. (These funds can be used to invest in health benefits, continued education, etc.)
  • Freedom to choose your own shift schedule...based on room availability and the needs of your clientele.
  • Collaborate and work alongside a multidisciplinary team of health and wellness practitioners.
  • Access our mentorship and guidance program to learn about direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, etc.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

  • Registered Massage Therapist with a minimum of 2200-hour certification.
  • Member in good standing of a recognized RMT association.
  • Recognized by all major insurance benefit companies.
  • *Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training are welcome to apply.

HOW TO APPLY

If the information and criteria presented above are of interest to you, we would love to have you join our team! Please submit an updated resume at your earliest convenience!

____________________

Salary: $60.00-$75.00 per hour

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
View our current Covid-19 protocols here...https://refinedhealthandwellness.ca/covid-19-prevention-st-albert-massage-therapy/

  • massage therapy: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

description:
Job description

WHAT WE DO

Integracare’s dedicated and exceptional team of Caregivers provide extraordinary care, which fosters client independence and joyful living in their chosen environment. We are seeking Registered Massage Therapists for private care in the community (1 to 1 care with flexibility to work weekdays, weekends and evenings).

WHAT OUR TEAM IS SAYING

  • “Integracare is like a family”

SKILLS REQUIRED

  • For “in the home” assessments and treatments.

  • Community Physiotherapist will be able to treat clients (generally Seniors) with a wide range of acute, chronic and pre and post op conditions.

Qualifications

  • Ability to communicate effectively with clients and the Integracare team
  • Adapt to and work effectively within a variety of situations

  • Minimum two years clinical experience an asset

TEAM PERKS:

ABOUT US

Integracare’s hiring practices are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live including those with disabilities. Integracare is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Athletic Therapist
description:
Tx Thérapies est une clinique multi-disciplinaire située dans le Vieux-Montréal, offrant des services en physiothérapie, massothérapie, kinésithérapie et thérapie du sport. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un ou d'une Thérapeute du sport pour se joindre à notre équipe composée de professionnels de la santé agréés.

Le candidat doit :

  • Être titulaire d'un baccalauréat en thérapie du sport
  • Atout : avoir complété une formation en massothérapie et être membre d’une association de massothérapie reconnue
  • Avoir de bonnes capacités en évaluation
  • Avoir des connaissances approfondies en pathologies
  • Être en mesure d'exécuter des traitements efficaces ainsi que de prescrire des plans d'exercices et de traitement adéquats
  • Posséder des connaissances et de l’expérience en entraînement physique
  • Souhaiter établir une pratique à long terme au sein de la clinique

--

Tx Therapies is a multi-disciplinary clinic located in Old Montréal, we offer physiotherapy, massage therapy, kinesiology and Athletic therapy. We are currently looking for an Athletic Therapist, to join our team of health professionals.

The ideal candidate must:

  • Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Athletic Therapy
  • Asset : Have completed supplemental training in massage therapy and be licensed to provide massage therapy receipts with a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Possess good evaluation skills
  • Have advanced knowledge of pathologies
  • Be able to execute effective treatments, as well as prescribe adequate exercise plans

Interested candidates must be available on either of these days: Monday,Thursday,Friday and Saturday. We are open to hiring multiple RMT's as well.

A Registered Massage Therapist’s primary responsibility is to provide professional massages offered by Miraj Hammam Spa which may include a variety of techniques including but not limited to: Swedish, Deep Tissue, Aromatherapy, Hot Stone, Sports Massage, Reflexology treatments. title: Massage Therapist
description:
2200 Hour Massage Therapist – Stony Plain, Alberta.

Body Renewal Massage Therapy Clinic is looking to welcome an exceptional Massage Therapist with 2200-hour certification to complement our close-knit team. We offer a great opportunity to work in a relaxed, friendly environment and to expand your knowledge and experience. Body Renewal has a reputation for providing the highest quality of health treatments and client service. We are a well-established clinic of 20 plus years, serving clients from Stony Plain, Spruce Grove, Parkland County, Edmonton and surrounding area.

This is a great opportunity to work in a Therapeutic clinic focused on client rehabilitation. Applicants must be a member of a recognized Alberta association and carry liability insurance. Multiple modalities are an asset, but not required. CPR/First Aid must be up to date.

We are currently seeking a full-time therapist however part-time may be considered. We are primarily a rent-based therapist-run clinic, however commission may be considered for the first three months if that is the preference of the successful candidate. Along with providing an educated and effective massage therapy experience, responsibilities include maintaining accurate notes of treatments performed, adhering to your regulatory body’s set of ethics and standards at all times, and laundry/cleaning/office duties as required. Training for clinic scheduling system and direct billing will be provided.

Please send your resume and cover letter to: Jackie Friedel, Co-Owner, Body Renewal Massage Therapy Clinic .

title: Massage Therapist
description:
LabX

LabX is changing the status quo of healthcare and disrupting the industry. This has been the driving forces behind building a brand that seeks to be transformational and patient focused rather than transactional. This is LabX!

We’re building a company that emphasizes community by curating an innovative approach to health and care. Every day we work to revolutionize the way we deliver. We prioritize the relationship we have with you, humanizing our brand and building a family matters to us. We are able to deliver care at every level because our treatments focus on holistic and preventative wellness.

Why LabX?

· 1 on 1 mentorship

· Supportive culture

· We focus on combining the innovative and cutting edge elements of culture, sports and healthcare

· We foster an environment for constant learning and growth. We make it an absolute priority to provide our clients with the best possible treatment

· We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where we support a team that feels included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly better serve

If you can see yourself thriving in a workspace that values these ideals, keep reading.

Core Values

Autonomy: The freedom to practice the way you want that best fits your individual talents as a practitioner.

Mastery: Continuing to learn and master your skills as a practitioner.

Purpose: We want to connect patients that value their health and wellness with practitioners that want to do their best with those patients.

· Designing customized treatment plans for various patients. Delivering one-on-one treatment

· Willing to learn and works well in a collaborative environment

· Certified with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario

description:
Join Our Team!

❀ Located in Kingston, ON

The Orchid Massage & Wellness Centre is looking for a Registered Massage Therapists to join our team in June of 2022. We are located in Kingston’s West End, our facility features quiet comfortable rooms in a relaxing spa like setting.

We support your professional needs, provide a great work environment, and fully accommodate our clientele.

Our facility was built for RMT’s by RMT’s. With the help of a professional interior designer, we created a space that is not only beautiful, but functionally designed with you in mind.

Large, open lobby & reception area with two reception desks so we can check in & check out clientele more efficiently. Fully integrated client management software for seamless booking, scheduling, payments & file management.

Our large staff lounge offers ample seating and dining areas, with a kitchenette and separate staff washroom. A separate office for charting, a lobby monitor so you can view when your clients arrive, individual coat, shoes/personal items storage & dedicated staff entrance.

Predictable income.

- Assisting with Doctor prescribed therapies, and working in a fast-paced team environment

- Setting patients up on various treatment modalities

- Performing routine office functions such as reception, patient scheduling, as well as handling patient and insurance billing

Scheduled hours of work are approximately 22 - 30 hours per week and our starting compensation ranges from $16-$19 per hour depending on experience. We are a growing multidisciplinary clinic, with a growing clientele in need of massage therapists immediately. Our location features private room settings, as well as gym equipment for active rehabilitation. Our philosophy prioritizes a hands-on approach along with traditional modalities, to help treat a wide range of acute and chronic injuries, as well as aid our clients in achieving their health-related goals. Our clientele is varied, ranging from the athletic to general population to those with disabilities or special needs.

We are looking to hire Massage Therapists (Registered) to join our growing team. Our therapists work together for inter-office referrals, in addition to receiving new patients from outside sources.

Our massage therapists are expected to provide our patients with a wide variety of treatment styles as well as treatment plans to improve our patients' health.

We are located at Church and Bloor. Within a 5 minute walk from the subway station.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $75.00-$90.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Necessary precautions are taken to prevent the spread of COVID.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (required)

title: Assistant Athletic Therapist
description:
Overview:
Term: 7 Months

This position is accountable to the Manager, Therapy & Performance Services to provide therapeutic treatments involved in the prevention, immediate care, rehabilitation and reconditioning of sports injuries sustained by student-athletes at the University. The incumbent also provides in-service training, scheduling and management of all student therapists assigned to their sports. The incumbent makes available all therapy services necessary for student-athletes and others participating in the varsity program environment while also treating general patients who utilize the Athletic Therapy clinics at the University.
Responsibilities:
Injury prevention/care
  • Provides all applicable care including injury prevention, education, acute and non-acute injury management, and rehabilitation for any injuries related to any varsity sports, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to attend practices for varsity sport programs, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • May be required to attend home and/or away games, as determined by the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Required to treat a number of paid clients. Goals set in consultation with the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
  • Use of secondary health care certification skill set when applicable
Collaboration/Communication
  • Provides regular updates to coaches related to pertinent injury information about their respective student-athletes
  • Collaborates as needed with Strength and Conditioning staff in regards to injury status of studentathletes
  • Communicates with various members of the Health Care team, including Sports Medicine Physicians, surgeons, chiropractors, etc,
  • May need to communicate with other members of the department as it relates to facilities, scheduling, booking, and invoicing
Mentorship/Education
  • Collaborates with AHS/Kin to recruit and train student trainers
  • Provides monthly learning sessions to further educate current student trainers
  • Assists with the yearly Student Trainer Orientation, to train and improve skills of new and returning student trainers
  • Oversees student trainers volunteering in the clinic
Clinical Administration
  • Completes any pertinent paperwork required to record major injuries requiring activation of EMS for care of injured student-athletes
  • Completes daily injury notes for all student-athletes seen in the clinic
  • Provides statistical reports reflecting injury rates, epidemiology, clinical revenue etc, to the Manager, Therapy and Performance Services
Clinic Promotion/Support
  • Collaborates with department marketing team to develop and implement strategies to increase clinic revenue
  • Utilizes social media as a promotional tool for the clinic
  • Maintains and expands relationships with community partners
  • Communicates with on-campus organizations to increase clinical access for students
  • Actively involved with the promotion of the clinics to clients from the community
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a health-related field
  • Diploma/Degree/Masters in the field of Athletic Therapy from an accredited institution required
  • Maintained status in the Canadian Athletic Therapists Association
  • Minimum First Responder certified
  • Secondary certification in health care an asset (ie chiropractic, occupational therapy, registered massage therapist)
  • Maintained status in applicable secondary governing body
  • Experience in a USports institution as an Athletic/Student Therapist preferred
  • Experience with contact sports (hockey, rugby, football) is an asset
  • Experience mentoring/teaching is an asset
  • Current in the area of clinical modalities, equipment, therapeutic techniques, and supplies related to therapy
  • Ability to communicate with all members of the Sports Medicine team, various coaches and athletes, and other members of the Department in a professional manner
  • Time management skills are essential
  • Maintain a clear Police Vulnerable Sector Check
  • Required to work evenings and weekends as needed
Vaccination Requirement Statement:
Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the University’s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The University’s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.
Equity Statement:
The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion. As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

title: Part Time Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Registered Massage Therapist
Seeking an enthusiastic Registered Massage Therapist to join the team at Unity Wellness! We are a multidisciplinary clinic offering Chiropractic and Massage, and have been serving the community for over 20 years. The demand for evening and weekend appointments is extremely high from our large existing clientele and the steady stream of new patients.

  • Member in good standing with NHPC, MTAA or RMTA
  • Proof of malpractice insurance

  • Experience treating clients in an outpatient setting is a strong asset (new graduates are still encouraged to apply)

  • Assist with clinic duties as required

title: Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist
description:
Athletic/Fascial Stretch Therapist
You are a fun, personable, outgoing practitioner and have a desire to excel in private practice. You’re always looking to develop your clinical knowledge and skills, and are eager to take on new and exciting challenges. Perhaps you are looking for your first role in a practice or maybe you just aren’t fulfilled with your career so far and know that there is a better opportunity waiting for you.

You’ll be our future therapist who has a strong interest in pursuing a fascial stretch therapy certification or already has one.

You’ll have great people skills, fantastic communication and enjoy working as part of a dynamic team and having a laugh and banter in our vibrant culture. You want to earn a fantastic salary and be financially rewarded as you grow your caseload. You want the opportunity to become more than just a standard team member because you know that you are able to deliver much much more.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is an award-winning wellness clinic featured on BlogTo and GlobalTV. Established in 1989 the Rosedale Wellness Centre has become one of Canada's leaders in providing quality care and innovative wellness programs for the community. With over 40 practitioners under one roof, Rosedale Wellness Centre provides a magnitude of different services. Some of the services include Chiropractic, Physiotherapy, Athletic Therapy, Naturopathy, Massage Therapy, Acupuncture, and Personal Training.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is currently looking for Certified Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist to join their busy downtown wellness centre.

Job Description

Prevention

  • Instruction to individuals on the use and application of commercially made or custom-made protective equipment to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • When required, provide custom-made devices or properly apply commercially made products in order to provide prophylactic/protective measures to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • Patient education on risks and corrective actions associated with participation in fitness and sport programs, workplace ergonomics and musculoskeletal injury prevention in both the active lifestyle and workplace settings
  • Facilitate physical conditioning by designing and implementing programs to reduce the risk of injury, illness or health-related conditions

Assessment

  • Formulate an Athletic Therapy diagnosis by interpreting the mechanism of injury; determining signs, symptoms and predisposing factors of an injury, illness or health related condition; performing specific physical, orthopedic or fitness testing in accordance with accepted procedures to assess an injury, illness and/or health related condition
  • Assess for/recognize the potential of a sport related traumatic brain injury/concussion
  • Assess the biomechanical impact of injury, illness or health-related condition to promote ergonomically correct function
  • Reassess the status of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions using standard techniques and documentation to determine appropriate treatment, rehabilitation and/or fitness and reconditioning plans

Intervention

  • When an emergency plan is activated, employ life-saving techniques through the use of standard emergency procedures to reduce the incidence of morbidity and mortality
  • Prevent exacerbation of non-life-threatening conditions through the use of standard procedures to reduce morbidity
  • Engage in rehabilitative therapy (including electrical, thermal, and mechanical modalities) using standard techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function, and/or performance
  • Administer therapeutic and conditioning exercise(s) using both standard and advanced techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance either pre- or post-injury or surgical intervention, as well as for general illnesses or conditions related to the musculoskeletal system
  • Educate and provide guidance and/or counseling to patients and individuals in the treatment, rehabilitation and reconditioning of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance
  • Educate, provide guidance and/or counseling for, and administer appropriate return protocols for patients returning from sport related traumatic brain injuries

Practice Management

  • Use an information management system to maintain appropriate medical records/documentation to comply with accepted best practice guidelines

Professional Responsibility

  • Adhere to policies and procedures for the delivery of healthcare services following accepted guidelines to promote safe participation, timely care and legal compliance
  • Maintain records using a system to document professional services rendered to provide quality healthcare services
  • Adhere to statutory and regulatory provisions for the practice of Athletic Therapy by maintaining an understanding of these provisions and responsibilities to contribute to the safety and welfare of the public

Interested candidates, please email your resume. New grads accepted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $22.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site gym
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • fascial stretch: 1 year (preferred)
  • athletic therapy: 1 year (preferred)
Show more

title: Mobile Massage Therapist
description:
Receive $300-500 STARTING BONUS when you join our team. (amount depends on # of years of experience).

Job type: Contract, Part-time, Full-time

Salary: $ 54-65 / hour +tips

Schedule: Flexible - MINIMUM of 20 massages/month (up to 30-35)

Areas to cover: Island of Montreal ( Westmount, Hampstead, Downtown, TMR, Griffintown St Henri, Old Port, Cote St Luc).

What we offer:

  • flexibility in schedule and days off
  • growth opportunities
  • casual work attire
  • safe work environment
  • large online presence where you can share your self-care tips
  • steady client flow
  • independence

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Have a professional training diploma in a minimum of two of the following: Swedish, Californian, deep tissue, sport, prenatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, lymphatic drainage, acupressure
  • Be a member of a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Must have a mode of transportation and all equipment to massage (massage table, sheets, oil)
  • Be self-employed and able to issue receipts

Qualities required:

  • reliable, punctual
  • excellent team spirit
  • respects confidentiality
  • excited to grow a clientele with us
  • loves to work with people

Bonus: If you have a Reiki certification

Blu Wellbeing Inc. is a reputable brand known for the ultimate mobile massage experience. Our company is holistic based purposed to inspire our community to selfcare daily. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram: @bluwellbeing)

We are looking for a dynamic person with recognized training. A trustworthy person, zen, warm and above all passionate about massage therapy.

If you are looking to make great pay, have a steady clientele, be a part of a beautiful team environment all while maintaining your work independent, then Blu Wellbeing is for you.

—————————-

Recevez un BONUS de départ de 300 à 500 $ lorsque vous rejoignez notre équipe. (le montant dépend du nombre d'années d'expérience).

Type d'emploi: Contrat, Temps partiel, Temps plein

Salaire: 54-65 $ / heure + pourboires

Horaire: Flexible - MINIMUM de 20 massages/mois (maximum: 30-35)

Zones à couvrir: Île de Montréal (Westmount, Hampstead, Centre-ville, St Henri, Vieux-Port, Côte St Luc, Griffintown).

Ce que nous offrons:

- flexibilité dans les horaires et les jours de congé

- opportunités de croissance

- tenue de travail décontractée

- environnement de travail sécuritaire

- grande présence en ligne où vous pouvez partager vos conseils d'auto-soins

- flux de clients stable

CONDITIONS:

- Avoir un diplôme de formation professionnelle dans au moins deux des disciplines suivantes : suédois, californien, tissus profonds, sport, prénatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, drainage lymphatique, acupression

- Être membre d'une association de massothérapie reconnue.

- Doit avoir un moyen de transport et tout le matériel pour masser (table de massage, draps, huile)

- Être travailleur autonome et pouvoir délivrer des reçus

Qualités requises :

- fiable, ponctuel

- excellent esprit d'équipe

- respecte la confidentialité

- ravi de développer une clientèle avec nous

- aime travailler avec les gens

Bonus : Si vous avez une certification Reiki

Blu Wellbeing Inc. est une marque réputée connue pour l'expérience de massage mobile ultime. Notre entreprise est basée sur une approche holistique et vise à inspirer notre communauté à prendre soin de soi au quotidien. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram : @bluwellbeing)

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique avec une formation reconnue. Une personne de confiance, zen, chaleureuse et surtout passionnée de massothérapie.

Si vous cherchez à gagner un bon salaire, à avoir une clientèle stable, à faire partie d'un bel environnement d'équipe tout en conservant votre indépendance de travail, alors Blu Wellbeing est fait pour vous.

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Application question(s):

  • What do you know about our company, Blu Wellbeing?
  • What is your massage therapy experience?

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-13

description:
Our office is Hiring Multiple Therapists Positions!!

Enhanced Health & Wellness is looking to add a Registered Massage therapist, Registered Physiotherapist, Registered Naturopath, Registered Acupuncturist, Registered Osteopath and more.

Our office has recently expanded into a brand new location with the intent to grow as a multi-disciplinary clinic, we would like to provide a team of experienced and qualified members to help patients focus on recovery and worry less on going to multiple offices for treatment.

  • Willing to actively work on building up their patient base

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Refined Health & Wellness would like to welcome a career-driven practitioner to our growing team of health professionals and enthusiasts. If you are a Registered Massage Therapist who is looking for a platform to elevate your practice, you have come to the right place!

Our position is open to both Registered Massage Therapists as well as Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training!

At Refined, we work as a cohesive group to manage the operational aspects of the clinic, and because we share in the responsibilities associated with reception, laundry, and clinic upkeep, our practitioners are eligible to earn commissions exceeding 70%.

Our mentorship and guidance program will provide you with training in the areas of direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, and much more!

As a valued member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work alongside other passionate and like-minded practitioners who have an affinity for their craft and who love what they do. Through collaboration and inter-referrals, you will be able to establish a strong and resilient practice.

Our clinic is outfitted with the highest quality amenities and equipment, ensuring that nothing will hold you back from offering the best possible experiences to your clients. Our treatment rooms are large with big, beautiful windows that overlook the Sturgeon River Valley!

Make Refined Health & Wellness the place where you can set the roots of your practice and explore your passions in the health and wellness disciplines!

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS

  • Starting commission of 65% with opportunities for advancement.
  • 'Bonus Pay Program' that offers additional percentage top-ups, providing practitioners the opportunity to earn commissions exceeding 70%. (These funds can be used to invest in health benefits, continued education, etc.)
  • Freedom to choose your own shift schedule...based on room availability and the needs of your clientele.
  • Collaborate and work alongside a multidisciplinary team of health and wellness practitioners.
  • Access our mentorship and guidance program to learn about direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, etc.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

  • Registered Massage Therapist with a minimum of 2200-hour certification.
  • Member in good standing of a recognized RMT association.
  • Recognized by all major insurance benefit companies.
  • *Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training are welcome to apply.

HOW TO APPLY

If the information and criteria presented above are of interest to you, we would love to have you join our team! Please submit an updated resume at your earliest convenience!

____________________

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $60.00-$75.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
View our current Covid-19 protocols here...https://refinedhealthandwellness.ca/covid-19-prevention-st-albert-massage-therapy/

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Job description

WHAT WE DO

Integracare’s dedicated and exceptional team of Caregivers provide extraordinary care, which fosters client independence and joyful living in their chosen environment. We are seeking Registered Massage Therapists for private care in the community (1 to 1 care with flexibility to work weekdays, weekends and evenings).

WHAT OUR TEAM IS SAYING

  • “Integracare is like a family”

SKILLS REQUIRED

  • For “in the home” assessments and treatments.
  • Referrals will be generated by Integracare.
  • Community Physiotherapist will be able to treat clients (generally Seniors) with a wide range of acute, chronic and pre and post op conditions.

Qualifications

  • University degree and registration /license with appropriate professional regulatory college (CMT)
  • Ability to communicate effectively with clients and the Integracare team
  • Adapt to and work effectively within a variety of situations
  • Flexibility
  • Minimum two years clinical experience an asset
  • Community experience an asset
  • Valid Vulnerable police clearance required
  • Please apply on Integracare

TEAM PERKS:

  • Uniform top and name tag provided
  • Training and Development provided on a monthly basis

ABOUT US

  • www.Integracare.ca

Integracare’s hiring practices are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live including those with disabilities. Integracare is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $100.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
Complete PPE will be provided.

description:
Calling all RMTs, New GRADS Welcome: Are you excited to transition from classroom to clinic? Secure your job before receiving your RMT license!

Take a tour of our fully-equipped facilities and picture yourself as a part of our welcoming Massage Addict team. We have pent up demand and are located in busy plaza with plenty of parking spots.

We offer free MCQ and OSCE prep courses upon signing service agreement!

As a full-time therapist, your compensation package will also include:

  • Extended Health Care Benefits
  • Allowance for professional development and training
  • Predictable bi-weekly income
  • In-clinic training and mentorship
  • Incentive and other programs
  • Room to learn and grow

Interested? We hope you will get in touch. We can’t wait to tell you about our changes, and why a career at Massage Addict is right for you.

Come and see for yourself! Book a tour at our clinic today and learn why over 1000 RMTs joined Massage Addict Family.

Massage Addict is proud to partner with The Arthritis Society

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Massage Addict is committed to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility for persons with disability. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: Athletic Therapist
description:
Tx Thérapies est une clinique multi-disciplinaire située dans le Vieux-Montréal, offrant des services en physiothérapie, massothérapie, kinésithérapie et thérapie du sport. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un ou d'une Thérapeute du sport pour se joindre à notre équipe composée de professionnels de la santé agréés.

Le candidat doit :

  • Être titulaire d'un baccalauréat en thérapie du sport
  • Atout : avoir complété une formation en massothérapie et être membre d’une association de massothérapie reconnue
  • Avoir de bonnes capacités en évaluation
  • Avoir des connaissances approfondies en pathologies
  • Être en mesure d'exécuter des traitements efficaces ainsi que de prescrire des plans d'exercices et de traitement adéquats
  • Posséder des connaissances et de l’expérience en entraînement physique
  • Souhaiter établir une pratique à long terme au sein de la clinique

--

Tx Therapies is a multi-disciplinary clinic located in Old Montréal, we offer physiotherapy, massage therapy, kinesiology and Athletic therapy. We are currently looking for an Athletic Therapist, to join our team of health professionals.

The ideal candidate must:

  • Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Athletic Therapy
  • Asset : Have completed supplemental training in massage therapy and be licensed to provide massage therapy receipts with a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Possess good evaluation skills
  • Have advanced knowledge of pathologies
  • Be able to execute effective treatments, as well as prescribe adequate exercise plans
  • Possess knowledge of and experience in physical training
  • Wish to establish long-term practice within the clinic

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $35.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Athletic therapy: 1 year (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Job Overview:

A Registered Massage Therapist’s primary responsibility is to provide professional massages offered by Miraj Hammam Spa which may include a variety of techniques including but not limited to: Swedish, Deep Tissue, Aromatherapy, Hot Stone, Sports Massage, Reflexology treatments. Where applicable, you must recommend a maintenance program for guest’s home care and wellness routine. You must ensure that the best treatment and service is offered and provide 100% guest satisfaction.

Qualifications:

  • RMT Designation with valid provincial licensing, accreditation and liability insurance
  • Fluency in English both written and verbal. Proficiency in other languages would be an asset
  • Computer literate and experience working with Resort Suite is an asset
  • Ability to work flexible hours including days, evenings, nights, weekends and/or holidays, including overtime as required
  • Must have excellent customer service skills and work ethic. Previous RMT experience in a luxury hotel/ resort spa is preferred

What's in it for you?

We offer competitive pay, gratuities, room for growth plus eligibility for a comprehensive benefits package. Additionally, gym membership and other great employee perks are constantly being added on as part of the employee wellness program.

Compensation?

Hourly + Service Flat Rate + Gratuities

Sound interesting?

Apply now. Your resume should reflect your suitability for this position. If our interests align, we will definitely contact you!

Miraj Hammam Spa is an equal opportunity employer and equally considers all applicants. Additionally, we are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. Should you require any accommodation during this process we will work with you to meet your needs.

Part-time hours: 25-40 per week

Salary: $50.00-$90.00 per hour

  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Mandatory Full Vaccination Policy for all employees. PPE and sanitation products provided.

Application question(s):

  • Are you legally authorized to work in Canada?

Experience:

  • Massage Therapists: 1 year (preferred)

  • Massage Therapist Certification (required)

title: Registered Massage Therapist (Predictable Income + Health Benefits)
description:
Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based network of health and wellness clinics. Join our team and be part of a movement that’s helping to improve the health of Canadians through four therapeutic services: Massage Therapy, Chiropractic Care, Acupuncture and Reflexology.

We invite you to contact us directly at (416) 357-6064 to arrange a meeting.

How we support our Massage Therapists: Our team provides full-service administrative support, which includes taking care of the rent, bookings, billing, and laundry so that you can successfully focus 100% on your clients’ therapeutic needs. Additionally, we’ll provide you with:

  • An established (and growing) client base; Full schedule from day 1!
  • Flexible scheduling that works for you
  • National, regional, and local marketing campaigns
  • Full-time reception coverage
  • All of your supplies, Hydraulics Tables & PPE’s

What we offer:

  • Flexible schedules- Day/evening appointments
  • An attractive compensation package
  • No non-compete clause
  • Electric lift tables
  • Full time reception and administrative team
  • Linens, pillows and other supports
  • Health-care benefits package
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Continuing education support
  • A collaborative multidisciplinary team who cross-refers clients within the clinic

What you’ll need to practice at Massage Addict:

  • Registered and a member in good standing with CMTO
  • Professional, positive, and passionate with a strong work ethic
  • A dedication to providing high-quality treatments to help clients feel their best!

We invite you to come take a tour of a clinic, meet our team, see our treatment rooms, ask as many questions as you like and discover why Massage Addict is a great place to work!

Locally Owned. Proudly Canadian: We are so proud of our East Coast roots that began, back in 2008, with a massage therapy clinic in Halifax. Over the years, as the market evolved and changed, we also evolved and changed, and grew to 100 clinics operating across the country. Seeing increased demand for additional therapeutic solutions led to the introduction of Reflexology (2018), Acupuncture (2019), and Chiropractic Care (2020). We provide 65,000+ treatments each month; 83% of which are to help relieve pain or reduce stress and/ or anxiety.

Massage Addict is proud to partner with The Arthritis Society.

New Grads (and soon to be Grads) are welcome and encouraged to apply! We look forward to meeting you!

Part-time hours: 10-25 per week

title: Massage Therapist
description:
LabX

LabX is changing the status quo of healthcare and disrupting the industry. This has been the driving forces behind building a brand that seeks to be transformational and patient focused rather than transactional. This is LabX!

We’re building a company that emphasizes community by curating an innovative approach to health and care. Every day we work to revolutionize the way we deliver. We prioritize the relationship we have with you, humanizing our brand and building a family matters to us. We are able to deliver care at every level because our treatments focus on holistic and preventative wellness.

Why LabX?

· 1 on 1 mentorship

· Supportive culture

· We focus on combining the innovative and cutting edge elements of culture, sports and healthcare

· We foster an environment for constant learning and growth. We make it an absolute priority to provide our clients with the best possible treatment

· We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where we support a team that feels included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly better serve

If you can see yourself thriving in a workspace that values these ideals, keep reading.

Core Values

Autonomy: The freedom to practice the way you want that best fits your individual talents as a practitioner.

Mastery: Continuing to learn and master your skills as a practitioner.

Purpose: We want to connect patients that value their health and wellness with practitioners that want to do their best with those patients.

Registered Massage Therapists Role

Responsibilities:

· Designing customized treatment plans for various patients. Delivering one-on-one treatment

· Willing to learn and works well in a collaborative environment

Requirements:

· Certified with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario

Contact Us

Website: www.thelabx.com

Instagram: instagram.com/thelab.x

Tiktok: thelab_x

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule

  • Weekend availability

title: Registered Massage Therapist - RMT
description:
Join Our Team!

❀ Located in Kingston, ON

The Orchid Massage & Wellness Centre is looking for a Registered Massage Therapists to join our team in June of 2022. We are located in Kingston’s West End, our facility features quiet comfortable rooms in a relaxing spa like setting.

We support your professional needs, provide a great work environment, and fully accommodate our clientele.

Our facility was built for RMT’s by RMT’s. With the help of a professional interior designer, we created a space that is not only beautiful, but functionally designed with you in mind.

Large, open lobby & reception area with two reception desks so we can check in & check out clientele more efficiently. Fully integrated client management software for seamless booking, scheduling, payments & file management.

Our large staff lounge offers ample seating and dining areas, with a kitchenette and separate staff washroom. A separate office for charting, a lobby monitor so you can view when your clients arrive, individual coat, shoes/personal items storage & dedicated staff entrance.

❀ What We Offer

✔ Positive, upscale, fun, and professional work environment
✔ Base wage paid whenever you are working (Charting, Cleaning, Client No Shows)
✔ Bonus pay program

✔ Medical Benefits
✔ Seven spacious service rooms with dimmable lighting and quality sound system.
✔ Team Member Lounge, Kitchenette, Private Bathroom and Office
✔ Separate Staff Entrance
✔ West end location with ample free parking for team members and clients
Off-Site Linen Washing & Sanitizing Service. Linens are delivered folded and ready to use.

✔ All supplies & equipment provided (lotions, oils, cups, hot stones, bolsters etc.)
✔ Online systems – allows you to monitor your schedule from your mobile device
Predictable income.
✔ We take care of your Remittances and HST.
✔ Professional Year-Round Marketing Campaign.
✔ Full administrative support and reception coverage

❀ About Us

Our goal is to provide great opportunities with living wages and a great working environment with a strong & supportive leadership team. As a family run business, we know our team is our greatest asset.

We are currently seeking a full-time therapist however part-time may be considered. We are primarily a rent-based therapist-run clinic, however commission may be considered for the first three months if that is the preference of the successful candidate. Along with providing an educated and effective massage therapy experience, responsibilities include maintaining accurate notes of treatments performed, adhering to your regulatory body’s set of ethics and standards at all times, and laundry/cleaning/office duties as required. Training for clinic scheduling system and direct billing will be provided.

title: Part Time Therapy/Administrative Assistant
description:
Linford Chiropractic Sports Therapy and Massage Clinic is seeking a dynamic, and outgoing individual to fill the need for a Permanent Part Time Therapy/Administrative Assistant role within our clinic. We recently filled our full time role and are now seeking to fill a more part time role. We invite applicants who recently applied for our full time job posting that are interested in this part time role to apply again.

Responsibilities Include:

- Assisting with Doctor prescribed therapies, and working in a fast-paced team environment

- Setting patients up on various treatment modalities

- Preparing and cleaning treatment areas between patients

- Basic laundry, cleaning, and equipment inventory tasks

- Performing routine office functions such as reception, patient scheduling, as well as handling patient and insurance billing

Candidate must be personable, energetic, and have a strong work ethic. They must be able to multitask in a fast-paced environment, be comfortable performing therapies on patients, and have strong computer skills. Previous schooling or experience is an asset but not a requirement as all training is done in clinic.

Candidate must be available to work scheduled shifts during our daytime clinic hours (shifts may vary slightly):

Mondays 9:30am - 12:45pm & 2:30pm – 6:30pm

Tuesdays 2pm - 6:30pm

Wednesdays 9:30am – 12:45pm & 2:30pm – 5:45pm

Thursdays 2pm - 6:30pm

Fridays 8am – 1:00pm

Saturdays (1-2 per month) 9am -12: 45pm

Scheduled hours of work are approximately 22 - 30 hours per week and our starting compensation ranges from $16-$19 per hour depending on experience. To apply for this position please email your resume. Visit our website at www.linfordchiropractic.ca for more information about our clinic. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist
description:
Athletic/Fascial Stretch Therapist
You are a fun, personable, outgoing practitioner and have a desire to excel in private practice. You’re always looking to develop your clinical knowledge and skills, and are eager to take on new and exciting challenges. Perhaps you are looking for your first role in a practice or maybe you just aren’t fulfilled with your career so far and know that there is a better opportunity waiting for you.

You’ll be our future therapist who has a strong interest in pursuing a fascial stretch therapy certification or already has one.

You’ll have great people skills, fantastic communication and enjoy working as part of a dynamic team and having a laugh and banter in our vibrant culture. You want to earn a fantastic salary and be financially rewarded as you grow your caseload. You want the opportunity to become more than just a standard team member because you know that you are able to deliver much much more.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is an award-winning wellness clinic featured on BlogTo and GlobalTV. Established in 1989 the Rosedale Wellness Centre has become one of Canada's leaders in providing quality care and innovative wellness programs for the community. With over 40 practitioners under one roof, Rosedale Wellness Centre provides a magnitude of different services. Some of the services include Chiropractic, Physiotherapy, Athletic Therapy, Naturopathy, Massage Therapy, Acupuncture, and Personal Training.

Rosedale Wellness Centre is currently looking for Certified Athletic Therapist or Fascial Stretch Therapist to join their busy downtown wellness centre.

Job Description

Prevention

  • Instruction to individuals on the use and application of commercially made or custom-made protective equipment to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • When required, provide custom-made devices or properly apply commercially made products in order to provide prophylactic/protective measures to minimize the risk of injury, illness or health related conditions
  • Patient education on risks and corrective actions associated with participation in fitness and sport programs, workplace ergonomics and musculoskeletal injury prevention in both the active lifestyle and workplace settings
  • Facilitate physical conditioning by designing and implementing programs to reduce the risk of injury, illness or health-related conditions

Assessment

  • Formulate an Athletic Therapy diagnosis by interpreting the mechanism of injury; determining signs, symptoms and predisposing factors of an injury, illness or health related condition; performing specific physical, orthopedic or fitness testing in accordance with accepted procedures to assess an injury, illness and/or health related condition
  • Assess for/recognize the potential of a sport related traumatic brain injury/concussion
  • Assess the biomechanical impact of injury, illness or health-related condition to promote ergonomically correct function
  • Reassess the status of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions using standard techniques and documentation to determine appropriate treatment, rehabilitation and/or fitness and reconditioning plans

Intervention

  • When an emergency plan is activated, employ life-saving techniques through the use of standard emergency procedures to reduce the incidence of morbidity and mortality
  • Prevent exacerbation of non-life-threatening conditions through the use of standard procedures to reduce morbidity
  • Engage in rehabilitative therapy (including electrical, thermal, and mechanical modalities) using standard techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function, and/or performance
  • Administer therapeutic and conditioning exercise(s) using both standard and advanced techniques and procedures to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance either pre- or post-injury or surgical intervention, as well as for general illnesses or conditions related to the musculoskeletal system
  • Educate and provide guidance and/or counseling to patients and individuals in the treatment, rehabilitation and reconditioning of injuries, illnesses and/or health-related conditions to facilitate recovery, function and/or performance
  • Educate, provide guidance and/or counseling for, and administer appropriate return protocols for patients returning from sport related traumatic brain injuries

Practice Management

  • Use an information management system to maintain appropriate medical records/documentation to comply with accepted best practice guidelines

Professional Responsibility

  • Adhere to policies and procedures for the delivery of healthcare services following accepted guidelines to promote safe participation, timely care and legal compliance
  • Maintain records using a system to document professional services rendered to provide quality healthcare services
  • Adhere to statutory and regulatory provisions for the practice of Athletic Therapy by maintaining an understanding of these provisions and responsibilities to contribute to the safety and welfare of the public

Interested candidates, please email your resume. New grads accepted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $22.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site gym
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • fascial stretch: 1 year (preferred)
  • athletic therapy: 1 year (preferred)

title: Mobile Massage Therapist
description:
Receive $300-500 STARTING BONUS when you join our team. (amount depends on # of years of experience).

Job type: Contract, Part-time, Full-time

Salary: $ 54-65 / hour +tips

Schedule: Flexible - MINIMUM of 20 massages/month (up to 30-35)

Areas to cover: Island of Montreal ( Westmount, Hampstead, Downtown, TMR, Griffintown St Henri, Old Port, Cote St Luc).

What we offer:

  • flexibility in schedule and days off
  • growth opportunities
  • casual work attire
  • safe work environment
  • large online presence where you can share your self-care tips
  • steady client flow
  • independence

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Have a professional training diploma in a minimum of two of the following: Swedish, Californian, deep tissue, sport, prenatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, lymphatic drainage, acupressure
  • Be a member of a recognized massage therapy association.
  • Must have a mode of transportation and all equipment to massage (massage table, sheets, oil)
  • Be self-employed and able to issue receipts

Qualities required:

  • reliable, punctual
  • excellent team spirit
  • respects confidentiality
  • excited to grow a clientele with us
  • loves to work with people

Bonus: If you have a Reiki certification

Blu Wellbeing Inc. is a reputable brand known for the ultimate mobile massage experience. Our company is holistic based purposed to inspire our community to selfcare daily. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram: @bluwellbeing)

We are looking for a dynamic person with recognized training. A trustworthy person, zen, warm and above all passionate about massage therapy.

If you are looking to make great pay, have a steady clientele, be a part of a beautiful team environment all while maintaining your work independent, then Blu Wellbeing is for you.

—————————-

Recevez un BONUS de départ de 300 à 500 $ lorsque vous rejoignez notre équipe. (le montant dépend du nombre d'années d'expérience).

Type d'emploi: Contrat, Temps partiel, Temps plein

Salaire: 54-65 $ / heure + pourboires

Horaire: Flexible - MINIMUM de 20 massages/mois (maximum: 30-35)

Zones à couvrir: Île de Montréal (Westmount, Hampstead, Centre-ville, St Henri, Vieux-Port, Côte St Luc, Griffintown).

Ce que nous offrons:

- flexibilité dans les horaires et les jours de congé

- opportunités de croissance

- tenue de travail décontractée

- environnement de travail sécuritaire

- grande présence en ligne où vous pouvez partager vos conseils d'auto-soins

- flux de clients stable

CONDITIONS:

- Avoir un diplôme de formation professionnelle dans au moins deux des disciplines suivantes : suédois, californien, tissus profonds, sport, prénatal, lomi lomi, shiatsu, drainage lymphatique, acupression

- Être membre d'une association de massothérapie reconnue.

- Doit avoir un moyen de transport et tout le matériel pour masser (table de massage, draps, huile)

- Être travailleur autonome et pouvoir délivrer des reçus

Qualités requises :

- fiable, ponctuel

- excellent esprit d'équipe

- respecte la confidentialité

- ravi de développer une clientèle avec nous

- aime travailler avec les gens

Bonus : Si vous avez une certification Reiki

Blu Wellbeing Inc. est une marque réputée connue pour l'expérience de massage mobile ultime. Notre entreprise est basée sur une approche holistique et vise à inspirer notre communauté à prendre soin de soi au quotidien. (www.bluwellbeing.com Instagram : @bluwellbeing)

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique avec une formation reconnue. Une personne de confiance, zen, chaleureuse et surtout passionnée de massothérapie.

Si vous cherchez à gagner un bon salaire, à avoir une clientèle stable, à faire partie d'un bel environnement d'équipe tout en conservant votre indépendance de travail, alors Blu Wellbeing est fait pour vous.

  • What is your massage therapy experience?

Our office has recently expanded into a brand new location with the intent to grow as a multi-disciplinary clinic, we would like to provide a team of experienced and qualified members to help patients focus on recovery and worry less on going to multiple offices for treatment.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Refined Health & Wellness would like to welcome a career-driven practitioner to our growing team of health professionals and enthusiasts. If you are a Registered Massage Therapist who is looking for a platform to elevate your practice, you have come to the right place!

Our position is open to both Registered Massage Therapists as well as Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training!

At Refined, we work as a cohesive group to manage the operational aspects of the clinic, and because we share in the responsibilities associated with reception, laundry, and clinic upkeep, our practitioners are eligible to earn commissions exceeding 70%.

Our mentorship and guidance program will provide you with training in the areas of direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, and much more!

As a valued member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work alongside other passionate and like-minded practitioners who have an affinity for their craft and who love what they do. Through collaboration and inter-referrals, you will be able to establish a strong and resilient practice.

Our clinic is outfitted with the highest quality amenities and equipment, ensuring that nothing will hold you back from offering the best possible experiences to your clients. Our treatment rooms are large with big, beautiful windows that overlook the Sturgeon River Valley!

Make Refined Health & Wellness the place where you can set the roots of your practice and explore your passions in the health and wellness disciplines!

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS

  • Starting commission of 65% with opportunities for advancement.
  • 'Bonus Pay Program' that offers additional percentage top-ups, providing practitioners the opportunity to earn commissions exceeding 70%. (These funds can be used to invest in health benefits, continued education, etc.)
  • Freedom to choose your own shift schedule...based on room availability and the needs of your clientele.
  • Collaborate and work alongside a multidisciplinary team of health and wellness practitioners.
  • Access our mentorship and guidance program to learn about direct billing, payment processing, clientele development, etc.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

  • Registered Massage Therapist with a minimum of 2200-hour certification.
  • Member in good standing of a recognized RMT association.
  • Recognized by all major insurance benefit companies.
  • *Student Massage Therapists in their 2nd year of training are welcome to apply.

HOW TO APPLY

If the information and criteria presented above are of interest to you, we would love to have you join our team! Please submit an updated resume at your earliest convenience!

____________________

Salary: $60.00-$75.00 per hour

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
View our current Covid-19 protocols here...https://refinedhealthandwellness.ca/covid-19-prevention-st-albert-massage-therapy/

  • massage therapy: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • 2200-Hr Massage Therapist Certification (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Job description

WHAT WE DO

Integracare’s dedicated and exceptional team of Caregivers provide extraordinary care, which fosters client independence and joyful living in their chosen environment. We are seeking Registered Massage Therapists for private care in the community (1 to 1 care with flexibility to work weekdays, weekends and evenings).

WHAT OUR TEAM IS SAYING

  • “Integracare is like a family”

SKILLS REQUIRED

  • For “in the home” assessments and treatments.
  • Referrals will be generated by Integracare.
  • Community Physiotherapist will be able to treat clients (generally Seniors) with a wide range of acute, chronic and pre and post op conditions.

Qualifications

  • Ability to communicate effectively with clients and the Integracare team
  • Adapt to and work effectively within a variety of situations
  • Flexibility
  • Minimum two years clinical experience an asset

  • Valid Vulnerable police clearance required

ABOUT US

Integracare’s hiring practices are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live including those with disabilities. Integracare is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Come and see for yourself! Book a tour at our clinic today and learn why over 1000 RMTs joined Massage Addict Family.

title: Athletic Therapist
description:
Tx Thérapies est une clinique multi-disciplinaire située dans le Vieux-Montréal, offrant des services en physiothérapie, massothérapie, kinésithérapie et thérapie du sport. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un ou d'une Thérapeute du sport pour se joindre à notre équipe composée de professionnels de la santé agréés.

Le candidat doit :

  • Être titulaire d'un baccalauréat en thérapie du sport
  • Atout : avoir complété une formation en massothérapie et être membre d’une association de massothérapie reconnue
  • Avoir de bonnes capacités en évaluation

--

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Job Overview:

A Registered Massage Therapist’s primary responsibility is to provide professional massages offered by Miraj Hammam Spa which may include a variety of techniques including but not limited to: Swedish, Deep Tissue, Aromatherapy, Hot Stone, Sports Massage, Reflexology treatments. Where applicable, you must recommend a maintenance program for guest’s home care and wellness routine. You must ensure that the best treatment and service is offered and provide 100% guest satisfaction.

Qualifications:

  • RMT Designation with valid provincial licensing, accreditation and liability insurance
  • Fluency in English both written and verbal. Proficiency in other languages would be an asset
  • Computer literate and experience working with Resort Suite is an asset
  • Ability to work flexible hours including days, evenings, nights, weekends and/or holidays, including overtime as required
  • Must have excellent customer service skills and work ethic. Previous RMT experience in a luxury hotel/ resort spa is preferred

What's in it for you?

We offer competitive pay, gratuities, room for growth plus eligibility for a comprehensive benefits package. Additionally, gym membership and other great employee perks are constantly being added on as part of the employee wellness program.

Compensation?

Hourly + Service Flat Rate + Gratuities

title: Registered Massage Therapist (Predictable Income + Health Benefits)
description:
Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based network of health and wellness clinics. Join our team and be part of a movement that’s helping to improve the health of Canadians through four therapeutic services: Massage Therapy, Chiropractic Care, Acupuncture and Reflexology.

We invite you to contact us directly at (416) 357-6064 to arrange a meeting.

How we support our Massage Therapists: Our team provides full-service administrative support, which includes taking care of the rent, bookings, billing, and laundry so that you can successfully focus 100% on your clients’ therapeutic needs. Additionally, we’ll provide you with:

  • An established (and growing) client base; Full schedule from day 1!
  • Flexible scheduling that works for you
  • National, regional, and local marketing campaigns
  • Full-time reception coverage
  • All of your supplies, Hydraulics Tables & PPE’s

What we offer:

  • Flexible schedules- Day/evening appointments
  • An attractive compensation package
  • No non-compete clause
  • Electric lift tables
  • Full time reception and administrative team
  • Linens, pillows and other supports
  • Health-care benefits package
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Continuing education support
  • A collaborative multidisciplinary team who cross-refers clients within the clinic

What you’ll need to practice at Massage Addict:

  • Registered and a member in good standing with CMTO
  • Professional, positive, and passionate with a strong work ethic
  • A dedication to providing high-quality treatments to help clients feel their best!

We invite you to come take a tour of a clinic, meet our team, see our treatment rooms, ask as many questions as you like and discover why Massage Addict is a great place to work!

Locally Owned. Proudly Canadian: We are so proud of our East Coast roots that began, back in 2008, with a massage therapy clinic in Halifax. Over the years, as the market evolved and changed, we also evolved and changed, and grew to 100 clinics operating across the country. Seeing increased demand for additional therapeutic solutions led to the introduction of Reflexology (2018), Acupuncture (2019), and Chiropractic Care (2020). We provide 65,000+ treatments each month; 83% of which are to help relieve pain or reduce stress and/ or anxiety.

Massage Addict is proud to partner with The Arthritis Society.

New Grads (and soon to be Grads) are welcome and encouraged to apply! We look forward to meeting you!

Part-time hours: 10-25 per week

title: Massage Therapist
description:
LabX

LabX is changing the status quo of healthcare and disrupting the industry. This has been the driving forces behind building a brand that seeks to be transformational and patient focused rather than transactional. This is LabX!

We’re building a company that emphasizes community by curating an innovative approach to health and care. Every day we work to revolutionize the way we deliver. We prioritize the relationship we have with you, humanizing our brand and building a family matters to us. We are able to deliver care at every level because our treatments focus on holistic and preventative wellness.

Why LabX?

· 1 on 1 mentorship

· Supportive culture

· We focus on combining the innovative and cutting edge elements of culture, sports and healthcare

· We foster an environment for constant learning and growth. We make it an absolute priority to provide our clients with the best possible treatment

· We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where we support a team that feels included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly better serve

If you can see yourself thriving in a workspace that values these ideals, keep reading.

Core Values

Autonomy: The freedom to practice the way you want that best fits your individual talents as a practitioner.

Mastery: Continuing to learn and master your skills as a practitioner.

Purpose: We want to connect patients that value their health and wellness with practitioners that want to do their best with those patients.

Registered Massage Therapists Role

Responsibilities:

· Designing customized treatment plans for various patients. Delivering one-on-one treatment

· Willing to learn and works well in a collaborative environment

Requirements:

· Certified with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario

Tiktok: thelab_x
